Job_Descriptions: Norges Bank Investment Management is responsible for the management of the Government Pension Fund Global. Our client is seeking a dedicated and results-orientated Analyst to join the Performance Measurement team. Performance Measurement is part of the Investment Risk area and responsible for ensuring the fund can measure performance in a highly structured and consistent manner across manifold dimensions in a dynamic landscape. The team are responsible for the maintenance and further development of our capabilities in measurement and analysis of the fund's performance. This entails both regular reporting activities as well as developing specialist insight into the fund's investment areas and their activities. Our client works closely with the investment side to ensure a structured and precise measurement setup, produce analytical insight into developments, support governance functions around the investment setup. What you will do In your role, you will become a specialist for the analysis and structure of an investment area and develop independent expertise and insight into relevant performance drivers. Additionally, you will contribute to the client's regular reporting activities and governance workflows, and further enhance their insight into historical and current performance. You will further contribute to client's cycle of continuous learning and enhancement of client's capabilities, by researching and utilizing new analytical approaches, improving the toolset chain, and contributing towards projects and initiatives related to performance and connected systems. In your role, you will also be exposed to many different aspects of investments risks. The position is located in Singapore and will report to the Head of Performance Measurement. Some travel may be required. Main responsibilities In close collaboration with the investment side, conducting performance measurement and analysis of specific investment teams/departments Generating new analytical insight into the drivers of performance and impact of investment decisions Improving existing and contributing to new technological solutions to enhance our automatization and analytical efficiency Proactive evaluate and streamline existing procedures by embracing technology, with a goal continuously improving productivity and analytical capabilities Contributing to recurring monitoring and reporting responsibilities In an agile and evolving environment, keeping on top of investment decisions and their implications Engaging with both Investment and Operational side of the fund to enhance our solutions and measurements What you need Master's degree in a financial, technological, or any quantitative discipline related skills with good academic records Able to collaborate and communicate with all parts of the organization and exhibit a high level of proficiency Possession of, or a solid interest to acquire, a thorough understanding of theoretical finance and the practical investment process Proven capability to handle and interpret quantitative data. Experience with data analytics and/or dashboarding using modern visualization tools would be an ideal Prior experience in an investment risk or performance analysis role would be an ideal Ability to leverage analytical insight and our technological capabilities to expand our technology stack Programming skills (in particular R or Python) and/or database experience(SQL) would be an ideal Who you are Possess a structured and reflected approach towards problem solving Enjoy team achievements and like to help your colleagues succeed Actively seek out learning and growth opportunities, both individually and for the team Not afraid to speak up when noticing issues or flaws Feel motivated by continuous improvements of existing solutions High level curiosity and detail-oriented mindset with an eagerness to learn What our client offers Staying healthy - They care about your health! That's why they offer excellent health, mental and dental benefits, including a comprehensive insurance for you and your FAMILY. You'll also be offered health assessments, counselling services and reimbursement of gym membership fees. Spending time with FAMILY - Becoming a parent? Don't stress! You'll get 16 weeks, GENDER-neutral, full base pay, parental leave to spend with your child. Mothers get an additional 10 weeks of PREGNANCY related leave. Recharge when you need to - All employees get 25 vacation days, and one extra for the last week of the year Work-life balance - Our client believes that a healthy balance is crucial for your well-being. When you work here, you'll be able to combine an exciting career in the world's largest sovereign wealth fund with a fulfilling life outside the office. Of course, there are several social clubs and events within the fund too if you'd like to combine the two! Planning for the long term - They contribute 17% or 20% of base salary to your CPF or SRS. You can focus on the present and don't worry about the future. Work with Purpose - Our client work to safeguard and build financial wealth for future generations. Through responsible investment and active ownership, we help shape the future of our world. Scientist (Analytical Development) Our client is a Leading Tobacco company in Singapore. We are currently looking for a Scientist to support the team. More information Location: Central 5 Days Work Up to $7000 depending on experience Responsibilities: Plan and perform activities on clearly defined programs, and track progress in relation to timelines/ time table. Implement and develop experimental methods and techniques based on the upcoming needs of the studies. Formulate short & simple runs, and establish the methods/techniques to meet high scientific standards, and act as the primary subject matter expert in these techniques Plan and perform daily work within bioanalytics and organizational levels, to organize the practical aspects of additional measurements in the study. Be the main point-of-contact for in vivo studies. Produce quality results within the required time frame, as well as analyze study related data & reports by applying scientific and technical principles to draw basic conclusions. Review routine data, monitor and escalate deviations. Identify and troubleshoot and resolve issues & gaps in processes to improve operational efficiency. Participate in several study-based activities within own team, perform daily routine measurements and perform analyses for non-routine measurements on equipment / systems for all studies as needed and act as the Subject Matter Expert. Participate and contribute in risk assessments. Plan, develop and perform activity related to qualification & validation set-up of new analytical endpoints and equipment. Able to configure complex systems. Maintain list of consumables required for the study and raise purchase requests in timely manner. Perform calibration & preventive maintenance of laboratory instruments. Manage and troubleshoot existing equipment and ensure calibration & maintenance schedules are updated as per instrument SOP. Be the system/process owner. Prepare technical method development reports. Develop and update standard operating procedures (SOPs) and work instructions (WKIs). Prepare SOPs and WKI in a timely manner to ensure that procedures are updated. Take up additional specialist tasks in other areas and perform cross functional activities. Job_Title: Assistant Manager / Senior Executive (Service Training) – Contract
Job_Descriptions: What the role is As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family. CPF members can use their CPF savings to buy a house, take care of their healthcare needs and save up for their retirement income for their golden years via the various schemes offered. If you are meticulous, a systematic thinker and derive satisfaction from helping others, you will fit right into this job. What you will be working on Curate and update training materials including eLearning modules. Collate and analyse statistics relating to training, audits, customer satisfaction and demand management. Perform User Acceptance Tests for customer servicing systems. Provide support for service audits and customer service surveys. Handle and support ad-hoc assignments. What we are looking for Possess initiative and positive attitude. Resourceful, able to work both independently as an individual and effectively as a team player. Good communication, organisational and analytical skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office tools, able to multi-task and works well in a fast pace environment.

What you will be working on Review existing land use policies and recommend new policies to support industrial restructuring or intensify land use that achieve land productivity, taking into account changing economic/business needs and trends while balancing the need to safeguard the resource for future needs. Manage the JTC land stock to ensure the optimal use of land. Formulate and track land recycling plan to support the redevelopment of land that optimises its use. Conduct regular reviews of work processes to ensure relevance and improve productivity including use of technology and automation. Lead and manage staff’s career development and progression Work closely with other divisions within JTC and other agencies on land use matters taking Whole-of-Government perspective into consideration. What we are looking for Qualification in Economics, Business, Real Estate, Geography or any related to the built environment sector Minimum 5 years of people management experience and in leading a team Possess strong communication skills with the ability to build effective and strong working relationships at all levels Strong leadership skills Excellent written and presentation skills required Training in geospatial analytics is an advantage

Wärtsilä is leading the maritime industry’s transformation towards a decarbonised and sustainable future. We at Wärtsilä Marine Power are proud to offer our customers the world’s widest network of maritime expertise and the full portfolio from engines to lifecycle solutions. We want to change the course towards an interconnected and cleaner maritime future and are constantly on the lookout for future-oriented talent to join our team and to work towards enabling sustainable societies with smart technology - together. Are you ready to jump onboard? This is a permanent opportunity and its location is Singapore. About the Position: Agreement Delivery Coordinator Your role will include the following accountabilities: Coordinate the logistics for tools, spare parts and workshop services according to the Maintenance Plan. Secure QHSE and compliance for the work and parts. Keep important stakeholder informed about the progress of the work. Actively update the Contract Manager when important issues occur. Direct customer contact for the logistics of tools, parts, cabins availability on vessels, permits and visa requirements. Proactively order field service jobs (Site & Workshop). Deliver parts, prepare tools shipments and coordinate workshop components so that maintenance activities can be executed on time without any delays. Consolidate shipment and arrange inbound and outbound transportation Ensure that contractual requirements are adhered when ordering spare parts and field services Work closely with the Field Service Coordinator before, during and after the work is executed to ensure that our contractual commitments are met. Timely and accurate reaction to customer requests. Handle or channel customer claims related to field services, parts and tools Manage proactively when changes to work plans occur in terms of job scope, timing, location and quantity Consolidate service work reports through the Field Service Coordinator and communicate to stakeholders Get assistance from Operational Support and Technical Services when needed Review and approve cost and provide correct input for invoicing Takes proactive actions towards the Wartsila internal parts delivery organization. Be creative in getting the parts delivered on time even if unconventional means must be used. Be an active member of the Contract Core Team To be successful in this role, you should: Diploma or Degree in Engineering or in other related disciplines 4 years working experience in the Marine and Offshore industry Structured and well-planned way of working Focused and can-do attitude Good co-operation, teamwork and communication skills Knowledge on operations and maintenance of large machinery Understanding of business service contracts Fluent in written and spoken English Good IT skills. Good practical knowledge and understanding of Marine Engines and Propulsion Systems and hands on experience in the use of SAP will be considered as a plus Why you and us All our employees are encouraged to utilise the variety of training activities, learning solutions and self-study materials that we have to offer which supports the opportunity to further develop your talents and competencies within a very global working environment, in an ambitious and growth orientated organisation.   Contact & next steps Does this sound like the job for you? If yes, we hope to hear from you before the application deadline 02 March 2022 by submitting your application through our careers portal. Are you still wondering if you should apply and would like to get something clarified? Please reach out to HyunJoo Kim, Talent Acquisition Specialist (***********@wartsila.com) with any questions related to this position (only for questions from direct job applicants, applications through email will not be recorded or responded to). Please apply by 02 March 2022 at 22:59 SGT. Our recruiting tool recognizes the time zone where the job ad has been published and closes the application period according to same time zone. Last application date: 02/03/2022 At Wärtsilä we value, respect and embrace all our differences, and are committed to diversity, inclusion and equal employment opportunities; everyone can be their true self and succeed based on their job-relevant merits and abilities. This is Wärtsilä Wärtsilä Marine Power leads the industry in its journey towards a decarbonised and sustainable future. Our portfolio of engines, propulsion systems, hybrid technology, and integrated powertrain systems deliver the reliability, safety, and environmental performance that Wärtsilä’s Smart Marine vision encompasses. We offer our customers performance-based agreements, lifecycle solutions, and an unrivalled global network of maritime expertise. www.wartsila.com/marine Wärtsilä is a global leader in smart technologies and complete lifecycle solutions for the marine and energy markets. By emphasising sustainable innovation, total efficiency and data analytics, Wärtsilä maximises the environmental and economic performance of the vessels and power plants of its customers. In 2020, Wärtsilä’s net sales totalled EUR 4.6 billion with approximately 18,000 employees. The company has operations in over 200 locations in more than 70 countries around the world. Wärtsilä is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. Find out more at www.wartsila.com.

What the role is [Hiring Cluster’s Description & Reporting Lines] As a central people agency, PSD has put in place various initiatives to help the Public Service respond to the many driving forces impacting the future of work and HR. To help officers manage the various transitions in their public service career and to ensure that the transitions are carried out smoothly, we are looking for an Assistant Director, Career Development and Transition. Reporting to the Deputy Director (Career Development and Transition), you will be part of the Workforce Development cluster in PSD. What you will be working on [Specific Job Responsibilities] You will provide leadership and strategic direction to a team to: Develop and implement innovative policies, programmes and incentives that facilitate career development and transition for public service officers (including mature officers and transiting officers), and enhance their employability Provide advisory and support to public agencies on end-to-end workforce transition matters from developing to executing the transition plans. Develop job pipelines through strategic collaboration and strong partnerships with internal and external stakeholders both within/outside public service, thereby creating pathways and programmes to facilitate successful placements. What we are looking for [Values] We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service. [Key Competencies and Experience] [Career Development]: The ability to develop and facilitate career development initiatives, frameworks and programmes for people to thrive in meaningful careers that support their individual aspirations. Equip public agencies with tools to support their employees’ development and career. [Career Transition]: The ability to design and develop initiatives to facilitate reskilling and to support a smooth career transition process for public officers. Identify and recommend appropriate career management resources available, which may include career counselling and coaching to identify needs and concerns, as well as knowledge of workforce development trends and the job market landscape. Strong in sourcing job pipelines, networking to build strategic partnerships for job placements. [Working Effectively with Stakeholders]: The ability to reach out, influence and mobilise stakeholders towards a collective purpose, engaging them to deepen understanding of issues and co-creating solutions together. Excellent in presenting and translating information/insights succinctly and effective in stakeholder engagement to obtain buy-in amidst competing priorities. [Serving with Heart, Commitment and Purpose]: The ability to display care and empathy in how we serve, translate ideas and executive policies, and to deliver decisively and persevere through challenging situations. Passionate about helping employees raise their employability. [Caring for, Developing and Inspiring Staff]: The ability to be an effective people developer who inspires and engages staff, and supports them in building their capabilities and capacity. At least 8 years of work experience in related areas including policy, human resources, career development and partnership engagement. [Personal Traits] Resilient with a propensity to persevere Resourceful and comfortable working in an ambiguous and fluid environment Only shortlisted applicants will be notified within 2 weeks after closing date. Successful candidates will be offered contract employment in the first instance.

Job_Title: Executive / Senior Executive, Business Transformation, FSSC, FAD
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) aspires to be a world-class organisation in delivering safety and security for our people. In pursuing our mission to make Singapore our Safe and Secure Best Home, we remain always constant and true to our core values of Honour and Unity. MHA Finance Shared Services Centre (FSSC) serves to increase efficiency and improve customer experience in financial services of the ministry and the Home Team Departments (HTDs). What you will be working on You will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining automation solutions for the FSSC, and will be accountable for the quality and performance of the automation. You will assist Assistant Director (Business Transformation) to drive continuous improvement through Business Process Reengineering (BPR) which involves identifying gaps and opportunities for the FSSC Service Delivery team and implementing new processes to achieve productivity targets. Other key responsibilities include designing, developing and running in-house training and workshops to educate FSSC officers on the usage of BPR and Robotic Process Automation (RPA) tools, conducting business process reviews with the FSSC teams to streamline processes and document opportunities for automation, i.e. develop RPA bots to automate financial transactions. What we are looking for a) Experience Experience in project management and involvement in innovation projects (e.g. develop Bots using RPA software) preferred Prior experience in conducting workshops or training courses will be an advantage b) Knowledge Skilled in one or more of the following areas: Project Management Professional, Six Sigma, Lean Six Sigma Green Belt, Design Thinking Knowledge in leading RPA Enterprise software (e.g. UiPath, Automation Anywhere) will be an advantage Familiarity with process mapping and problem-solving techniques will be an advantage c) Attributes Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to articulate business problems and elicit business needs Able to take a broad, strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges on upstream and downstream processes Strong facilitation, communication and presentation skills, with the ability to pitch ideas and gain stakeholder buy-in on proposed solutions Able to work independently with stakeholders Pro-active, resourceful and self-motivated to innovate and drive new ideas, especially in Bot development Highly driven with a resilient attitude and with a desire to drive change Our officers may be deployed to frontline positions or have frequent interactions with members of the public. Candidates who are not fully vaccinated and do not intend to get vaccinated have higher risk of COVID complications and will not be considered for the position. All new appointees will be appointed on a two-year contract in the first instance. We wish to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified within 30 days upon closing of the advertisement.

Job_Descriptions: What the role is What you will be working on Monitor and provide monthly report on Rice stockpile in country Handle all customer enquiries from importers and interested parties Maintain rice portal Support MTI on Rice licensing and enforcement Ensure proper governance for procurement, storage, management and disposal/distribution of all FEA (Food Emergency Authority) stockpile For FEA, plan, project and account for all financials of essential firms Upgrade and maintain the rice portal and integration to Calista Harness data analytics to review for diversification, sufficiency and price of various types of rice over time and sense for risk What we are looking for Meticulous with a strong analytical mind and ability to work under pressure to meet tight schedules Having both private and public sector experience will be advantageous Strong interpersonal, communication and business partnering skills are required in order to work across functions and levels of management Candidate must be a pro-active, independent, and hands-on team-player Highly analytical and motivated individual with good work ethic 3 years post qualification experience is preferred but applicants with no experience may apply.

Job_Title: Wavemaker | Social & Content Executive Singapore, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Description Position at Wavemaker Overview of the Role Wavemaker Singapore is currently looking for a Social & Content Executive to join the Social & Content Team based in Singapore. Our team is rapidly growing, so you should be comfortable (and flourish) in a deeply dynamic environment. In this role, you will be key point of contact for accounts across both internal and external stakeholders. Ideally, you are passionate and driven individual with experience managing social media content strategy, creative conceptualisation, reporting and production. Reporting of the Role This role reports to the Senior Social and Content Manager, Wavemaker Singapore. 3 best things about the job: Opportunity to be exposed to wide range of businesses from various industries. Develop and grow capabilities within the Social and Content department. Be at the intersection of Media data, Content Strategy and Creative work. Measures of Success In three months: Establish a strong working relationship across multiple clients in varied business verticals Gain a good understanding of client and internal media teams’ business processes and functions Build rapport with your creative team to ensure a high quality of work output In six months: Ability to interpret and extract insights from social media content data though regular reporting Able to provide strategic input and counsel to both clients and internal partner teams Contribute to new business opportunities In twelve months: Identify and lead new business opportunities across client accounts Position self as a key point-of-contact across content and social media related for both clients and internal partner teams Responsibilities of the role: Act as key client liaison across all client work, including campaigns and ad-hoc intiatives Effectively manage workloads and output quality Craft and implement social media content strategies for clients Project management and internal coordination of creative and media teams for the timely production and delivery of client assets Oversee video production briefs and projects Contribute to the execution and presentation of new business opportunities Extract data-based social media & content recommendations and execute accordingly What you will need: 2 to 3 years of experience in digital advertising/design related field, preferably with agency experience Experience in managing relationships across multiple clients in varied business verticals Good project management skills, particularly in the areas of social media and digital content production Background in social media account management, content strategy and basic copywriting Capability to understand, interpret and formulate insights from social media data Basic understanding of paid social media process and metrics. Excellent presentation skills and communication abilities Video production project management experience is a plus About GroupM GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment. GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with. About Wavemaker We always believe there is a better way to grow our clients and our people. We do this by positively provoking growth for our clients and people. We work with clients to help them grow and shape their consumers’ brand decisions and experiences through media, content, and technology. We have one single attitude – Positive Provocation. Our name is our mission and our method. To make waves, you need to be provocative, even fearless. We always make sure we have each other’s backs through our inclusive culture. We do our best work for brave brands and people who want to be challenged to go further and faster. We know it’s not easy, but if it’s in you, we will get it out of you. Our attitude of Positive Provocation is enabled by: The deep Knowledge we have of our clients’ business The confidence to Challenge what’s gone before The Support to go further than we thought possible We are a part of GroupM, WPP’s global media investment management company. Discover more on wavemakerglobal.com, Twitter and LinkedIn

Job_Title: GroupM | Talent Acquisition, Executive Singapore, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Description Position at GroupM Overview of job GroupM is the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. We are currently looking for a Talent Acquisition, Executive to join us. In this role, you will be responsible for leveraging on recruitment technology and using creative talent attraction techniques to bring in the best and brightest talents across the globe to GroupM. At GroupM APAC, our people are our strength, which is why fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion is important to us. Reporting of the role This role reports to the Talent Acquisition Manager. 3 best things about the job: You will recruit best talents for the world’s leading media agency group where you will partner strategically with all our agencies’ business leaders, MDs, CEOs etc. Work in a fun and fast-paced industry at the heart of digital, data, analytics, content and technology, and we value new ideas and thinking to bring in the next wave of best talents for our business Demonstrate your talent vision and leadership that will transform and inspire the Singapore talent acquisition team to become a stronger strategic partner for the business and group. In this role, your goals will be: In three months: Build up a solid understanding of the media and digital industry, agencies’ business structure and talent requirements Establish a strong business relationship with our agencies’ stakeholders and understand their needs and desired expectations. Be familiar with internal practices, process and policies, and technology available, and partner closely with the Talent Acquisition team In six months: Review and recommend smart and effective recruitment tools/technology to attract best talents in shortest time Be involved actively in training Programs and provide data occasionally to support hiring strategies and processes In 12 months: Identify as the trusted talent acquisition partner for our agencies and group Increase the % of hires through internal program (e.g referral program) Successfully built a talent pipeline for the businesses. What your day job looks like at GroupM: Build an open, collaborative and authentic agency relationship across all levels that will support and manage the agencies’ requirements and desired expectations Work closely with the Talent Acquisition Manager to implement the talent acquisition strategy across the group Partner effectively with the commercial heads and agency leads on hire requests and approval from regional HQ in ensuring on time hire requests submitted Research and implement new strategies and technologies to build relevant talent pipeline, and always encouraging the talent acquisition team to be proactively searching, connecting and identifying top talents in the market Cultivate an open and nurturing culture with the mindset to train and coach, helping the team to overcome work challenges and contribute effectively Provide effective recruitment advice, guidance and solutions to all hiring managers across the group, including statutory obligations Maintain a good knowledge and understanding of competitive compensation in the media and digital industry Ensure all relevant Sarbanes Oxley Compliance procedures and processes are followed, adhered to and evidenced at all times Actively search and drive all recruitment initiatives/programs that promote both foreign and local hiring What you’ll bring: Extensive experience and track record of high volume of roles in media, marketing, digital Ability to multi-task, prioritize and deal with ambiguity in a highly complex matrix structure Highly solution-driven, adaptable, and possess a strong growth mindset Proven senior stakeholder management experience Loves speed and accuracy, and collaborative relationships at all time! Strong presentation and negotiation skills More about GroupM GroupM leads and shapes media markets by delivering performance enhancing media products and services, powered by data and technology. Our global network agencies and businesses enable our people to work collaboratively across borders with the best in class, providing them the opportunity to accelerate their progress and development. We are not limited by teams or geographies; our scale and diverse range of clients lets us be more adventurous with our business and talent. We give our talent the space, support and tools to innovate and grow. Discover more about GroupM at www.groupm.com Follow @GroupMAPAC on Twitter Follow GroupM on LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/company/groupm About Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means, that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients, renowned brands and media owners. Making GroupM Singapore the Number One organisation to join and develop your career in media investment. GroupM is an equal opportunity employer. We view everyone as an individual and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the global clients we work with.

What the role is [Cluster’s Description] The Leadership Development Cluster oversees the Leadership and Talent Development policies and approaches at the Public Service level, to achieve the following key outcomes: Effective and High-Performing Leaders & Leadership Teams that deliver with excellence today and innovate for tomorrow Leadership Corps with Greater Diversity in experiences, skillsets & perspectives One Public Service Leadership with a common purpose, identity and values We do so by ensuring that our leadership development (LD) approaches are fit-for-purpose. This includes how we identify, develop, and engage senior Public Service Leaders and leadership talents on the central leadership programmes (the Administrative Service and Public Service Leadership Programme). We do so in close partnership with our training partner, the Civil Service College as well as the HR community and leaders across the Public Service. What you will be working on [Overview of role] In this role, you will be part of the team maintaining a central overview and developing a pipeline of potential Board members to sit on public boards (e.g. Boards of Statutory Boards). You will also be engaging external stakeholders and potential partners to build a database of suitable candidates to recommend for board appointments. In addition, you will have the exposure to conduct career conversations with officers and account manage private sector organisations to source for potential partnerships and roles to facilitate external attachment opportunities for public officers. [Specific Job Responsibilities] Reporting to Head (Talent Attachment), you will: Formulate and review policy and frameworks relating to board of directorships for senior public sector leaders of the Singapore Public Service. Identify and recommend suitable candidates from both the public and private sectors to be appointed to the relevant boards and organise engagement sessions for potential private sector candidates to assess their suitability. Perform Board Secretariat functions which include supporting all board nominations, processing appointments/re-appointments and other related administrative matters like managing directorship fees payments, and maintenance of systems and databases for the board of directorships. Collaborate with training partners to identify suitable training programmes and developmental interventions to equip board directors with necessary skills to perform their duties. Partner public officers on their career development plans by facilitating suitable external attachment and development opportunities. Engage and account manage private and people sector organisations for external attachment opportunities. What we are looking for [Values] We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service. [Work Experience & Competencies] An ideal candidate should possess the following: [Talent Management] Able to lead the implementation of talent management processes and initiatives to identify and manage board nominees; recommend and deploy assessment tools to identify talent with relevant skills and competencies required for effective functioning of the boards. [Communications & Relationship Management/Working Effectively with Stakeholders] Able to design communication and engagement platforms and initiatives to build positive relationships and rapport with stakeholders, and identify possible collaboration areas with them. You should also possess strong communication (written and verbal) and networking skills to meaningfully engage senior stakeholders. [HR Policies, Processes & Legislation] Able to review policies and processes relating to board appointment matters and external attachment programmes , and develop resources to support implementation and adoption of policies and processes. [Learning and Development] On board directorships related matters, able to design the approach and methodology used to analyse learning needs and assess current capabilities; able to customise learning and development strategies to maximise effectiveness of learning and development initiatives. At least 2 years of working experience in the field of recruitment/HR management. [Other Traits] Resourceful, analytical, organised and meticulous Effective team player who can work well in a fast-paced environment, and under tight timelines Applicants will typically be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of the job posting. Successful candidates will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance.

Job_Title: Partner Programs Manager, APAC (based in Singapore)
Job_Descriptions: The Partner Programs Manager is responsible for helping to manage and support the evolution of the Zoom Up Partner Program in the APAC region.  In this dynamic and multi-faceted role, he/she will help maintain, support, and grow the partner programs regionally.   The Partner Programs Manager will support and execute an annual compliance process to measure and monitor partners’ performance against program requirements.   This role will also be responsible for enrolling new partners, managing the contractual process, and supporting other channel program initiatives as needed.  The Partner Programs Manager will have experience in managing programs to support Software as a Subscription (SaaS) models including Renewals and will be required to work cross functionally to ensure successful adoption of the Zoom Up Partner Program.    This individual will use a data driven approach that also incorporates partner feedback and internal feedback to ensure an outstanding program and partner experience in a very fast paced, hyper-growth company. Responsibilities Regional Partner program support.  Skilled at working cross functionally with a range of teams including sales, finance, legal, enablement, marketing, operations, product management, to support program definition and execution Being the go-to-person in regional for Partner Program related questions and owning proper supporting documentation and processes Drive and manage program compliance annually in region, partnering with Channel Account Managers Manage partner contracting process in region Provide regional support for launching program updates, including communications and documentation Special projects as needed, in support of the Global Partner Programs organization Own and report on partner performance and participate in regular business reviews with leadership and stakeholders Requirements Min. 5-7 years of partner program experience in SaaS industry, including experience in direct advising and persuading, and negotiating at all levels of seniority Experience of working with Reseller and Distribution Partners across multiple geographies Strong project management and organizational skills Current experience in a high growth enterprise software company, with SaaS/Cloud business models Skills Experience in managing and launching industry leading partner programs Demonstrated record of building and fostering durable business relationships Strategic thinker with a sales mentality and a proven ability to execute strategy Partner-based experience at an international SaaS company Strong analytical and presentation skills Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) Strong leadership skills to achieve or exceed goals Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Zoom’s values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives including qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records as well as any qualified applicants requiring reasonable accommodations in accordance with the law. We believe that the unique contributions of all Zoomies is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Zoom requires all U.S. employees who will work in person at a Zoom office, attend in-person Zoom meetings or have in-person customer meetings to be fully vaccinated.  Zoom will consider requests for reasonable accommodations for religious or medical reasons as required under applicable law. Explore Zoom: Hear from our leadership team Browse Awards and Employee Reviews on Comparably Visit our Blog Zoom with us! Find us on social at the links below and on Instagram

About this role: This position will support the APAC Sales & Operations teams.  You will be an integral member of a truly dynamic and exciting team, with responsibility for managing and evolving the business plan models and well as developing brand new solutions from the ground up.  You will support the business by gathering requirements and bringing them to life as well as driving end user adoption to the platform.  You will lead all GTM operational initiatives in support of the Regional Vice President for APAC.  You’ll be a part of the sales planning team that is responsible for creating and managing the solution that is used to support the APAC sales organization on territory, quota, and performance management.  You will work closely with IT, sales operations, and finance to drive alignment, transparency, and process improvements.  We’re seeking someone with a “roll-up your sleeves” attitude, a problem solver, strive to drive process efficiency, and a tech-savviness as well as the ability to communicate effectively across teams. Responsibilities: Work with Revenue Operations leadership to translate business requirements into a design, and then lead the build, test and deployment Work cross functionally to develop connected planning functionalities that support all aspects of sales planning and operations and finance Support business user enablement and trainings Create end user documentation and administration documentation Perform ad-hoc reporting and support scenario analysis as needed Qualifications Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience Six or more years of relevant work experience Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite; expert Excel and PowerPoint skills desired Working knowledge of quota management and forecasting modeling tools Willingness to travel up to 25% A Master's in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, or Economics is a plus High degree of strategic and analytical capability, including the ability to analyze a large amount of data Strong strategic skills, with the ability to identify and assess key points, implications, and recommendations; proven ability to structure business case around a high-level strategic vision Knowledge of report query and design Communication skills and ability to focus on the details Demonstrated experience in continuous improvement initiatives, root cause analysis and project management Experience with Salesforce.com, MS-Power BI

Location: Suntec Tower Three, 3, Temasek Boulevard, Downtown Core, Singapore, 38983, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description CREATE ‘WILD’ SOLUTIONS for WILDLIFE! We are looking for a creative mind to engineer solutions for our varied Wildlife projects. We invite you to join us at Mastermark Pte Ltd for a ‘wildly’ exciting engineering career! You will be at the forefront of Singapore’s bird and wildlife management, striving to provide a resolution to wildlife and human conflicts. We are driven by the excitement of building new technologies, inventing products, providing consulting advice and services that turn nature conflicts into long-term business opportunities. We have worked with hundreds of organisations, both government and private sectors, and we are seeking an enterprising Engineer to join our team and fill this role! Your Role: This position plays an important role in supporting our varied wildlife projects which require engineering expertise. Specifically, you will: • Be part of a team exploring and developing several wildlife trapping/ deterrent/ proofing systems and remote monitoring devices. • Innovate and improve existing wildlife traps/ deterrent/ proofing systems and remote monitoring devices. • Integrate multiple existing systems into a singular product and solve problems related to these systems. • Manage engineering projects from start to end, including design, material selection, conception, prototyping and trials of these systems. Our Requirements: • Degree in Engineering, preferably Mechanical Engineering. • 2-5 years of working experience in design/ development/ R&D. • Able to work with the team and external stakeholders on multiple projects concurrently. • Able to clearly explain engineering and design choices of the product to management and clients. • Able to work independently and keep abreast of industry technical developments • Familiarity with Raspberry Pi or Arduino would be a bonus. • Experience with implementing electrical components (e.g. rechargeable batteries) into a system would be an advantage. • Enjoy the challenge of providing ‘Wild’ engineering solutions to our varied real-life problems out in the ‘Wild’. Regional, Singapore / HR & Corporate Service – Procurement / Permanent, Full-time Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries. At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry. Reporting to the Regional Procurement Excellence Manager, the Regional Procurement Associate will be looking after the procurement in and out for the company which includes but not limited to liaising closely with cross functional business units for issuance of PO for Regional office purchases, tactical sourcing, analyzing market trending and tender management within the region. The incumbent will also support regional supply management topics to ensure supply continuity and also manages supplier performance evaluation. Responsibilities Prepare and issue purchase orders within the Reg office. Contact suppliers to resolve price, quality, delivery or invoice issues Adhere to any health, safety and environmental policies and procedures to ensure the safety and wellbeing of self, staff and visitors Ensure compliance to company guidelines, purchasing policies and procedures during supplier negotiations and contracts award process. Support Reg Proc Excellence Manager on implementation of Procurement System and User Training across the Region Support Reg Proc Excellence Manager implementation and local customization of Procurement Policy and SOP across the Region Support Reg Proc Excellence Manager to ensure audit compliance across the Region on a regular basis Source and purchase goods, and services in line with specified cost, quality and delivery targets for the region Support regional tender as required Build, maintain and manage supplier relationships in a professional and consistent approach Compile data relating to supplier performance to enable evaluation with stakeholders when required Requirements A diploma/ degree holder in any fields 1 - 2 years of relevant experience in sourcing and buying Experience in ERP systems migration and experience in IT and Facility related purchases will be an advantage Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and G- suite especially in excel / google sheet Strong communication and negotiation skills - written and verbal, and ability to work with cross-functional teams. Familiar and comfortable with using ERP systems (e.g., NetSuite / SAP).Explorer - the ability to self-serve, investigate and get required data Open minded and willing to learn and serve - we are looking for people who are able to accept and take up challenge in a start-up environment Team player - able to work well and help each other as a team Demonstrate honesty and integrity in running tender projects. Description Position at Essence About the role Joining the regional accounting team as a Senior Accountant, your primary responsibility will be to manage the accounting books for Essence Singapore entity in terms of accounting, month-end closing, management reporting, and statutory matters. With a fast growing business and increased complexity in the financial reporting processes and compliance requirements, this role is critical to ensure the accounting records adhere to the internal compliance requirements and local financial reporting standards and other statutory requirements. Duties and Responsibilities : ● Responsible for day-to-day operational accounting activities and month-end closing which include preparing journal entries, accruals, accounting schedules, reconciliations etc. ● Responsible for the timely submission of monthly full set of financial accounts, management accounts and reporting within the stipulated deadlines. ● Ensure accuracy and completeness of all accounting records and financial reports in accordance with accounting standards and company policies ● Handle queries from local and regional finance team ● Assist in implementing and complying with the ICFR (SOX) requirements. Preparing ICFR documentation for review by the deadlines ● Assist in ICFR audit ● Assist in quarterly forecasting and annual budgeting process. ● Maintain fixed assets register including additions, disposals, depreciation, asset tagging, etc. ● Maintain Costar lease accounting system ● Responsible for statutory matters including external audit, GST filing, Corporate tax, Transfer pricing documentation, Government Statistic Survey, etc. ● Key contact to liaise with auditor and tax agent ● Responsible for the intercompany reconciliation, identifying and resolving mismatches during month-end closing. ● Vendor/ customer/ employees account creation in SAP accounting system ● Other ad-hoc assignments to support business and management or finance related projects from time to time A bit about yourself : ● This role is only open for Singaporean and SPR ● Degree in accountancy/professional certification. i.e: ACCA, CPA, etc. ● At least 5 years’ of working experience in accounting and reporting related functions ● 2-3 years experience in a reputable audit firm is preferable ● Good Knowledge of FRS reporting standard ● Proficient in MS Office applications, such as Word and Excel; experience in Google Docs and Sheets will be an added advantage. ● Able to effectively communicate in the English language, verbally and in writing. ● Responsible, diligent and attentive to detail; follows through on queries and issues ● Good analytical and statistical computation skills ● Good problem solving skill ● Good communicator, especially dealing with internal and external stakeholders ● Taking ownership and commitment in meeting deadlines. ● Independence and work under minimum supervision ● Able to work under pressure ● Experience in SAP, BFC, Concur systems will be an added advantage. What you can expect from Essence Essence’s mission is to make advertising more valuable to the world. We do this by employing the world’s very best talent to solve some of the toughest challenges of today’s digital marketing landscape. It’s important that we hire people whose values reflect those of our own: genuine, results-focused, daring and insightful. As an Essence employee, we promise you a workplace that invests in your career, cares for you and is fun and engaging. We believe these factors create a workplace where you can be yourself and do amazing work.

Requirements Typically 15+ years in complex IT service business environment sales. University or Bachelor's degree; advanced or MBA preferred. Demonstrate broad knowledge of corporate policies, products, markets and processes, and an understanding of business management principles and practices. Demonstrate mastery to state- of-the-art technical, functional or business knowledge. Demonstrate managerial and planning skills. Managed successfully at least 3-5 large managed services or applications and analytic deals. Unique and comprehensive industry knowledge in multiple key industry IT domains both internal and external to the company. Capable of working with client to develop their high- level IT strategy and roadmap. Capable of entering into a dialogue about value exchange for pricing innovation or where the company is not the low-cost provider. Has extensive experience in developing and maintaining strong industry network of partners and customers.

Job Title: Senior Cybersecurity Engineer About Circles.Life Circles.Life is the world’s first and fastest growing Vertical SaaS technology company. We offer ‘Digital Telco as a service’ around the world via Circles-X, a 100% cloud-based, world’s first Digital Telco Operating System. With Circles-X, our clients can now provide Best-in-class Experience and an Ecosystem of Digital services to their customers. Circles.Life was founded by Rameez Ansar (ex-Temasek, BCG), Abhishek Gupta (ex-McKinsey, Bain Capital, StanChart PE) & Adeel Najam (ex- Nokia, Huawei, Starhub), who are supported by an all-star leadership team including C-suite executives from Tata Docomo, Paypal, Vodafone, Bharti Airtel, Hooq/ Singtel, and Flipkart (to name a few) Circles.Life is funded by top Venture Capital firms such as Sequoia, EDBI, Founders Fund, and Warburg Pincus and we were voted the Top Employer in Digital Telco and also became an accredited winner in showcasing excellence in workplace culture. To find out more about Circles X, click here: https://cxos.circles.life/ Job description: We are looking for a Senior Cybersecurity Engineer who will work with the Cyber Security team and other Engineers to ensure Circles.Life systems and its global offices are protected against security threats and are compliant with in-country cyber security and data protection regulations. As a key member of our team, your responsibilities include: Being part of the build up and day to day running of cyber security operations, cyber governance or cyber defence. Cyber Operations: Implementing and managing network security appliances, endpoint/mobile protections, patch management, devops security, and perimeter and cloud security measures. Being involved in SOC implementation and administration to actively monitor the organisation’s IT environment. Performing internal/external threat security assessments and taking ownership to address the gaps. Responding to security incidents, including resolution and remediation, and continually enhancing the capability of the incident response team and the organisation by conducting table-top exercises. Driving IT Security initiatives to enable the organisation to achieve its strategic and business objectives. Researching new security technologies, threats and vulnerabilities and implementing relevant preventive and detective measures. Cyber Governance Developing IT Security policies, procedures, guidelines and baselines. Ensuring organisational compliance with internal IT Security policies, standards and procedures, as well as external regulations (e.g., ISO27001, GDPR, SOC2, MAS TRM, PCI-DSS, PDPA, etc.) Being involved in IT Change Management and evaluating the security impact of proposed changes. Driving IT Audit readiness review and facilitating timely issue resolution. Performing security advisory on products and infrastructure. Conducting IT Risk Assessments, IT Security Audits and Compliance Reviews. Conducting vendor/partner IT security due diligence reviews. Leading the Cyber Education programme in the organisation Cyber Defence Conducting security source code reviews and VAPT (mobile, web, network), including security in the CI/CD pipeline (DevSecOps). Participating in security solutioning Performing network/cloud architecture security review and recommending best security practices. Conducting technical security assessment on in-house and vendor-developed applications. Reviewing security configurations on servers operating systems, databases, and network security devices. Conducting technical cybersecurity exercises (e.g., red teaming) Required Qualifications: Passionate about Cybersecurity Diploma, Degree or Cyber Security related qualifications. Min.5 years’ experience in IT Security Operations, Cyber Governance or Cyber Defence (e.g., VAPT, security solutioning). Familiar with industry standards such as ISO 27001, GDPR, SOC2, PDPA, NIST, PCI-DSS, MTCS and TRM. Good command of English, both written and spoken. Able to take ownership, an out-of-the box thinker with modern concepts and initiatives who likes to come out of the comfort zone with a can-do attitude. Preferred Qualifications: Comfortable in a startup environment – we’re fast-paced, self-motivated, and determined to change the industry Experience in product-based / hyper-growth environment highly advantageous IT security related certifications are preferred but not mandatory. Some examples of relevant certifications include: Cyber Operations/Cyber Governance: Security+, CISSP, CISA, CISM Cyber Defence: OSCP, OSCE, GPEN Knowledge of the following is a plus: Telco Operations; Cloud Infrastructure and Security, DevSecOps, SOC Monitoring, Endpoint/Mobile Security; IT Security Consulting/Audit, Third Party Due Diligence. What’s on offer: One of Circles.Life's key missions is to build the best place to work and grow. In order to do that, we offer: Exponential career growth & ownership - Completely own your own career and determine how fast and in which direction you grow. Being in a hyper-growth environment means having the opportunity for 10x the learning at 10x the speed; watch your role expand as the company expands. Impact from Day 1 - Translate idea to action and help us to blaze the trial for innovative products and shake up the telco world, and beyond. Talent Mobility - Circles.Lifers are given the opportunity to change roles internally, across functions and/or offices, through multiple structured programs (i.e. internal transfers, job shadowing or job rotation). We've witnessed many successful examples -e.g., from HR lead to Business Development Senior Manager. Talent Development - We stand for a culture of continuous learning and growing. Besides structured career development paths and quarterly performance reviews, we offer monthly learning brown bag sessions, manager training and L&D budget to support development of professional interests and efforts. Attractive Total Rewards (Salary + Equity) - We offer highly competitive salary and bonus inline with top tier technology companies, and equity for ALL employees (up to 6 months of annual salary worth for top performers). That means, unlimited upside based on company's performance. Benefits - Mobile bill reimbursement for all Circles.Lifers and their dependents and medical insurance. Bonus: Well-stocked pantry and monthly fun activities. Circles.Life will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require sponsorship of a visa. Circles.Life is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, disability or age.

About the Company Circles.Life is Asia’s first and most successful digital telco and we are on a mission to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar industry. We launched our services in 2016 and have been rapidly gaining market share while delivering best in class customer experience. Till date, we are leading the market in terms of NPS, subscriber growth, data used per subscriber and overall customer satisfaction. We have an opening for a Technical Project Manager who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure in a hyper-growth environment in Singapore. Do you want to get first-hand insights on how a hyper-growth company operates? Are you interested in being part of a fun, energetic team that thrives in an entrepreneurial tech environment? If the answer is YES, read on to find out more about the role at Circles.Life! As our Technical Project Manager, you will be taking on an important role in the centre of our cross-functional Product and Engineering Team, and you will be given a unique opportunity to work on high impact projects across different teams, and your responsibilities are as per below. Facilitating the end-to-end delivery of Circles.Life’s Products (Mobile, Web and Backend) and ensuring they are shipped against the target deadlines and standards. Establishing trust with a variety of internal and external stakeholders, eliminating non-value-add activity and blockers, and also finding creative ways to accelerate project delivery is a must. Providing progress updates and reports to the various department heads, and also feeding relevant information back to the teams. Capturing feedback from various teams and continuously improving the team’s agile approach. Facilitating daily stand-ups, meetings, demos, retrospectives and various decision-making processes in order. Requirements Minimum 8 years of experience as a Program/Project manager in driving and managing complex projects in a Product-Based Company. A successful track record of leading large cross-functional teams with the ability to manage priorities across multiple teams and functions is imperative. Exceptional stakeholder management skills with the ability to communicate the Project progress/risks/reports to all organisation levels is a must. Superior communication skills, including driving and leading the functional/technical discussions with the Engineering/Product/QA teams critical to the delivery. Experience in developing tools/processes to improve team productivity will be beneficial. Strong knowledge and experience in Agile Methodology and frameworks like SAFe, Scrum, Kanban etc. Strong coaching abilities and team-building skills to drive adoption of agile scrum methodology. Knowledge of the entire SDLC, Agile Techniques (User Stories, CI/CD, TDD, Continuous Testing, Automated Testing etc.) Knowledge of backlog tracking, burn-down metrics, velocity, user stories etc. A strong embodiment of our Company’s cultural values. What’s on offer: Circles.Life provides a great environment and platform for employees to build their career. In this role, you can expect: The unique opportunity to be a part of the digital disruption in telecommunication (Circles.Life is the only company of its kind in all of Asia!). Autonomy in the role and in managing your own portfolio. Exposure to the fast-paced world of high-tech start-ups. Attractive experience and compensation. Working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment. To all recruitment agencies: Circles.Life will only acknowledge resumes shared by recruitment agencies if selected in our preferred supplier partnership program. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Circles.Life employees or any other company location. Circles.Life will not be held accountable for any fees related to unsolicited resumes not uploaded via our ATS. Circles.Life is very agency friendly and as such we would encourage you to share your interest at ************@circles.asia and we will review your application based on our hiring needs.

We seek a passionate and committed candidate to work on the fabrication and development of hybrid quantum devices with the long-term goal of building a scalable and error free quantum computer. The design of relevant quantum devices and the development fabrication recipes for realising such devices will be a crucial area of research and development. Particularly, we are interested in developing the technology to interface spin- and photon-based qubit options and develop hybrid systems with potential for interconversion between stationary and flying qubits. This position resides in the Quantum Materials and Devices group at the Institute of Materials Research and Engineering (IMRE), A*STAR. As part of our research team, you will contribute to the development and characterisation of relevant materials and processes, device fabrication and measurement for quantum devices with the goal of establishing interfacing between solid-state spin qubits and photon-based qubit options suitable for transmission. Main Responsibilities Relevant materials characterization and device measurements. Design and setup of relevant photon-based quantum systems. Design and fabrication of hybrid quantum devices. Provide technical documentation and manuscript writing. Job Requirements PhD degree in physics, applied physics, or related fields. Laboratory experience in materials processing and device/system design and implementation. Ability or strong interest to work across solid-state systems and photon-based systems is a requisite for building hybrid quantum devices. Proven experience in quantum device fabrication and/or quantum phenomena studies (e.g. Coulomb blockade, phase coherence studies (fermions/bosons), etc.) would be advantageous. Ability to work unsupervised and collaboratively with a team. Resourceful in problem solving and critical thinking. Meticulous and analytical in experimental work. Good presentation skills (written and verbal). Good command of English.

Description: This position will be the Sales leader for multiple territories/countries in South East Asia, working directly with our channel partners in assigned Territories. They will have direct responsibility for Territory Sales Targets, building and managing a strong opportunity funnel to deliver these targets, and reporting responsibilities. They will work with the team to implement and drive product & sales strategies across the channel network and work with the Sales team to drive preference for EMERSON Actuators. Job Responsibilities: Expected activities include, but will not be limited to: Sets Yearly and Monthly Financial Goal for Distribution Channels and help them exceed those goals. Track and Report Monthly Performance. Provides technical support to internal sales teams as well as customers by reviewing applications and specifying appropriate actuators. Identifies White Space in assigned Territories and then develop channel plan to capture White Space opportunity. Collaborates with Regional Sales & Project Pursuit leaders to identify and win projects. Works closely with the product marketing team on new market developments and product updates. Become an expert on the Products and Territories Represented. Provides sales and product training for the Distribution channels, End Users, EPCs to drive preference. Develops, records and presents insights on the Asia Pacific Actuation market to regional and global management including but not limited to competitors, pricing, product gaps etc. Has full ownership of Measuring, Tracking & Reporting progress for overall business for territories/countries managed. Additional Information: Must be customer focused leader with sales and business development competencies. They will have demonstrated knowledge of Valve Automation / Actuation technologies or related industries. They will have a solid understanding of the different stakeholders EPCs, OEMs, Competition as well as Industry insights. Personal attributes such as self-starter attitude, great people skills and high integrity are a must for this role. Job Requirements: Engineering Degree with 5 years of sales experience in Valve Actuation or instrumentation and control systems or related industry. Ability to analyze complex situations and ability to define and clearly articulate a plan of action. An aptitude in solution-based selling (not price negotiation only) is a must. Good verbal and written communication skills in English – knowledge in Chinese will be an added advantage to liaise with Chinese speaking customers. Some supervisory experience is preferred, Travel is expected 30% of the time.

Job Description Great opportunity to showcase your technical knowledge and customer service skills Innovative, fast-paced, and market-leading organization Permanent Full-Time role based in Singapore Dynatrace Autonomous Cloud Enablement (ACE) Services ensures successful adoption of Dynatrace technologies throughout the software application lifecycle to provide real-time analytics which helps our customers proactively avoid performance issues and to rapidly diagnose and resolve problems should they occur. The Professional Services Consultant is a vital member of the team, responsible for the delivery of Dynatrace professional services. The role focuses on customer success and technology adoption, working with customers and helping them maximize the value that Dynatrace delivers, enabling delivery of high-performing applications with a first-rate customer experience. Customer environments will vary widely. Significant performance problems may take down customer applications, creating a high-stress, time-critical working environment. Other situations may need a more measured approach with rigorous change control and approval processes. Regardless, engagements often take place in cross-organizational, highly political, and visible atmospheres so excellent communication and customer management skills, and the ability to constantly make progress and add value while keeping all parties updated on progress, are essential skills. You will have a high-tech background with an application focus and will be intuitive problem-solvers comfortable in complex environments, seeking a wide variety of challenges to help them grow. A strong understanding of appropriate technologies (described briefly below) is required as this role calls for more than simple product installation and configuration. You will be required to develop skills in using Dynatrace technology to help isolate and analyze application performance problems. You will interact with a wide variety of roles both business and IT need to gain mastery of this knowledge along with the ability to communicate clearly, credibly, and confidently. Responsibilities: Earn the confidence of customers, partners, and colleagues as a trusted advisor in Application Performance Management Represent Dynatrace as a product expert on its technology Deploy, administer, configure and maintain Dynatrace technology Ensure effective monitoring of critical business applications at customer sites Build and enhance dashboards, reports and alerts to meet customer requirements Help customers troubleshoot, profile, and predict application performance issues Mentor and train customers on Dynatrace technology and best practices Build Dynatrace brand loyalty and uphold Dynatrace solution against competitive threats Qualifications Extensive experience working as Professional Services Consultant / Delivery consultant within IT Industry Excitement and eagerness to learn new technology Passion for IT development and desire to gain in-depth knowledge Bachelor’s degree or minor in any of the following: Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Math or equivalent training or course work experience Basic knowledge of Java, C#, .Net, Python or similar programming languages Interest in web programming and Object-Oriented design Fluent spoken and written English Excellent interpersonal skills Additional Information We take our Employer Brand and internal culture seriously. So much so, we are consistently recognized by reputable companies and brands like Business Insider, USA Today and Forbes. This year so far, Dynatrace scored a seat on Comparably’s award lists for Best Company Outlook, Best Company Global Culture, and Best Places to Work in Boston, to name a few. Dynatrace was also honored in the coveted Top Workplaces USA list in 2021. And we’re proud to be recognized on BuiltIn Boston’s 2021 'Best Large Companies to Work For' and 'Best Paying Companies.' We’ve got it made—won’t you join the #DynatraceLife? #LI-1204

What do we do? DPS is a leading Project Management and Engineering Company delivering Full-Service Engineering with a ‘client first’ mentality and personal touch across a range of market sectors: Project and Programme Management, Procurement, Design, Construction Management, Health & Safety Management, Commissioning, Qualification and Start-up. We have one goal: to deliver more than our clients expect first time, every time. We’ve been serving industry around the world for over 45 years, relied on for our agility, original thinking, sound judgment and high-calibre people. What sets us apart is the rapport we build with our clients and the care we take to gain a fundamental understanding of our client’s businesses. We employ over 2100+ people out of our seventeen office locations and we serve a broad range of clients ranging from multinational companies to small generic producers. What are we looking for? DPS has an excellent opportunity for a highly motivated and ambitious CSV Engineer for a Pharmaceutical Project in Singapore. The role will support various CSV projects including ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning Systems), MES (Manufacturing Execution System), Data Historian, PLC / SCADA, DCS (Distributed Control Systems such as Emerson DeltaV, Yokogawa, Siemens Simatic PCS 7), LIMS (Laboratory Information Management System) and CDS (Chromatography Data System). This position will be expected to work in our client’s site across Singapore Island. Job Scope: · Responsible for working with multi-disciplinary project teams to deliver compliant, risk-based CSV services to our clients in Singapore · Develop/review/execute life-cycle related CSV documentation: User Requirement Specifications (URS), Functional Specifications (FS), Risk Assessments (RA), plans, protocols, requirement traceability matrices, summary reports, etc. · Initiate and document deviations and perform associated investigations in line with client procedures · Initiate and document change control (as required) in line with project/client procedures · Supporting the CQV Lead in delivering quality validation packages that both meet the project schedule and client expectations · Ensure full compliance to regulatory, quality, and best practice standards Job Requirements: · Bachelor’s Degree in IT, Engineering or Science · Must have 4+ years of experience working on CSV projects in a GxP environment · Experience with any of the following systems will be an added advantage: ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning Systems), Information Management Systems, Data Historian, PLC / SCADA, DCS (Distributed Control Systems – DeltaV or Siemens PCS7), LIMS (Laboratory Information Management System) and CDS (Chromatography Data System) · Excellent written and verbal communication skills. · Strong organizational and project management skills. · Familiar with GxP, GAMP 5, 21 CFR Part 11, ANSI/ISA-88, etc. Next Step: · Prepare your updated resume (please include your current/last salary package with full breakdown such as base, incentives, annual wage supplement, etc.), expected package and your notice period. · Interested candidates kindly forward your CV to **************@dpsgroupglobal.com · All information will be kept strictly confidential.
