Want to be a part of Asia-Pacific’s (APAC) fastest growing data centre business? AirTrunk is an APAC technology company with a powerful purpose - to scale and sustain the relentless growth of the region’s digital future. We do this by continuously redefining and delivering data centres that meet the needs of our customers, the world’s most transformational companies. And we’re doing so sustainably, for today and tomorrow. Having opened Australia’s first and largest hyperscale data centres in Western Sydney and Melbourne in 2017, we set our eyes on rapid expansion across APAC. Since then, we launched in Singapore, Hong Kong, Sydney North and Japan, and announced plans for our second Western Sydney data centre which will be the largest in APAC. With backing from our investors including Macquarie Group, this is just the beginning… Join us at AirTrunk, where the cloud meets the ground. A Snapshot As the Executive Assistant, you will report to the Deputy CEO and the Group Technology Officer and make your mark in a number of ways: Supporting the leaders of AirTrunk’s Technology and Commercial divisions during a period of exciting growth in the Asia Pacific region By strong understanding of the data centre industry and ability to align AirTrunk's departments, you will be instrumental in making sure our senior executives’ time is optimally used to deliver and achieve AirTrunk’s goals. Your Day to Day Provide C-suite executive-level administrative support to two Regional Executives, including extensive diary management, inbox management and travel Manage a wide range of contacts, both internally and externally Supervise and review administrative operating systems and procedures, making recommendations for efficiencies and improvements Produce correspondence, presentations and reports, both of a general and confidential nature Participate in ad-hoc projects and activities as required by your leaders, and the broader leadership team and organisation Support the data centre operations team in regular data centre tours for customers, investors and partners when required; including supporting the on-the-ground team in managing access protocols, security arrangements and ensuring compliance of COVID safety measures Communications & Marketing - support the APAC marketing team and business leaders in: Internal communications – crafting and delivering the strategy for how we communicate internally, with content that connects AirTrunkers to our strategic narrative Content – developing AirTrunk’s content across multiple presentations and employee communications/events. Build engaging, insightful, and targeted content that is aligned with our brand. Consistency - Ensure internal and external communication messaging and language is consistent across all platforms. Be the AirTrunk brand champion to the internal partners. Compliance - ensure alignment of internal guidelines and compliance across internal communications, presentations and documents Events - events planning, coordination and implementation (physical or virtual) Requirements Prior experience as an EA, supporting at least two C-Suite level (ideally MD level and above) as well as experience in marketing or marketing activities within the data centre space is crucial Successfully supported leaders across multiple regions in APAC Broad knowledge of administrative processes, with highly-developed organisational and administration skills with the ability to forward plan and think strategically Strong business knowledge and excellent communication skills Enthusiastic, personable, and able to collaborate closely with a range of different departments, including C-suite leadership Autonomous and thrive in a fast-paced environment Positive demeanour to challenges, a solutions-focused and creative approach to balancing priorities during peak periods Resilient, flexible and agile with strong attention to detail and accuracy in all activities Excellent at MS Office Suite, including experience in understanding board and executive presentations/reports Discretion when handling sensitive and confidential information. The AirTrunk Culture Working at AirTrunk is a once in a lifetime opportunity to fast-track your career and make a positive impact. At AirTrunk, we’ll help you [email protected] The pace of our industry means you’ll feel an electric atmosphere at AirTrunk. We are a team of challengers and collaborative problem solvers who break new ground every day. We do this by living our values; going above and beyond, and being dynamic, transparent and responsive. Every AirTrunker brings their own unique background and diverse perspective to find solutions to problems that matter. We’ve created a flexible and safe working environment where everyone feels welcome, heard, and equal regardless of age, disability, gender, gender expression, marital or parental status, race, colour, religion or belief, national origin, sexual orientation or veteran status. With a range of exciting employee benefits for you to choose from, we’ll help you stay positively charged in both your work and life. **To all recruitment agencies: AirTrunk does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, AirTrunk employees or any other organization location. AirTrunk is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.**

Job Title: Principal Engineer About Circles.Life Circles.Life is the world’s first and fastest growing Vertical SaaS technology company. As a key member of our team, your responsibilities include: Working closely with other Engineers to develop the best technical design and strategy Derive the most viable technical solution to solve business needs by paying attention to functional and nonfunctional requirements while providing the hands-on technical leadership to implement the same. Owning the delivery of various timelines, ensuring that key milestones are met and deliveries are of the highest quality. Establishing various best practices for software development (eg. documentation, testing), and encouraging their adoption with the team and organisation. Collaborating with other engineering teams to inform intelligent API development and ensure high quality delivery Collaborating with other non-technical stakeholders of the business which includes Product Managers, Designers, Marketing etc. Mentoring an excellent team of talented engineers and working with Engineering leadership to coach and upskill junior developers. Strong design and architectural experience in building various highly-scalable and highly-available cloud-based web apps (millions of consumers) Strong understanding of the SDLC Activities which include Analysis, Design, Development, Testing, Deployment and Post-Production Support. Significant hands-on expertise in one or more of these software stack Backend: GoLang, Node.JS or similar stacks Frontend: Modern Javascript, React, Redux, HTML and CSS or similar stacks Mobile: Swift/Objective-C,  Java/Kotlin or cross platform development such as Flutter, React Native, Ionic Telco Business Support Systems: Oracle stack (BRM version 7.5 onwards/ECE/PCRF/OCOMC), and experience solutioning through major industry standard (eg. eTOM, SID, TAM, ITIL, OSS/j,TM Forum) Performance Engineering: Full stack with excellent work experience in Containerization and Kubernetes, Cloud computing platform (AWS/GCP/Azure) and applications involving Message Brokers (eg. kafka, RMQ), databases (eg. RDBMS, NOSGL), caching systems and load balancers. Experience in MicroServices based development Experience working in an Agile environment, including practices like Continuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD) and Test-Driven Development. Excellent analytic, problem-solving, oral and written communication skills with the ability to thrive in a high performance team Preferred Qualifications: Comfortable in a startup environment – we’re fast-paced, self-motivated, and determined to change the industry Experience in product-based / hyper-growth environment highly advantageous Experience in collaborating with Product teams and Managers Working knowledge in Domain Driven Development and modeling complex business domains would be an advantage Experience working as part of and directing geographically dispersed, diverse, and virtual teams Hands on experience with SQL/NoSQL databases Experience with mentoring and upskilling junior developers Familiarity with UX principles for creating delightful Customer Experiences What’s on offer: One of Circles.Life's key missions is to build the best place to work and grow. Being in a hyper-growth environment means having the opportunity for 10x the learning at 10x the speed; watch your role expand as the company expands. Impact from Day 1 - Translate idea to action and help us to blaze the trial for innovative products and shake up the telco world, and beyond. Besides structured career development paths and quarterly performance reviews, we offer monthly learning brown bag sessions, manager training and L&D budget to support development of professional interests and efforts. Danilo Giannoni, our Creative Director and Founder of ARTE ORO, started the Singapore-based company in 2017. Job_Title: Group Customer Insights and Strategy Lead
Job_Descriptions: Hi! Hyphen Insurance is modernizing how insurance is bought in Asia by putting customers at the center of everything we do. Using innovative technology and a data-driven approach, we strive to provide consumers with the best policies, best value, and best customer service in the industry. And as if that isn’t enough, it’s really just the beginning at Hyphen Insurance. Our true ambition lies in making protection simple, fair and fun and educating people which product is the right one for them. Because, at the end of the day, when you need protection you want to have the right partner on your side. With products available in 6 markets and ranging from personal and commercial lines to life & health, the Hyphen Insurance team is dedicated to helping create value for the whole financial ecosystem. We are a proud Asian start-up with 10+ million monthly visitors on our platforms. We’re seeking the most passionate and skilled talent to redefine the role insurance plays in people’s lives. THE ROLE You will be running the most strategic insurance and insurtech projects of Hyphen Group. This role will manage digital, technology, operational or commercial projects across 6 markets. To be successful, you need to have a good understanding of how to set-up, manage and drive initiatives in a traditional or agile environment. Key tasks include set-up of milestone plans, financial and commercial reports, governance and proactive communication with stakeholders. A successful candidate will show strategic thinking, a broad understanding of multiple areas from technology to business (marketing, finance and business development) and is highly motivated to further develop and grow a successful start-up organisation in an exciting ecosystem. You will also work closely with the regional insurance and insurtech team and manage various projects that will not just challenge your current know-how but will help to grow your leadership and build a culture, strategy and vision for the strategic projects organisation. ABOUT YOU We are looking for a Strategy leader to help foster Hyphen’s customer first mentality by establishing our Customer Insights and Go to Market Strategy function. Reporting directly to the Head of Insurance, this dynamic team leader will be responsible for developing customer, brand, and market insights that form the foundation of Hyphen’s insurance growth and marketing strategies. This role is a unique opportunity to impact the growth and strategy of the Hyphen Insurance Platform brand as it re-defines customer expectations in the massive Asia insurance space. The successful candidate will possess strong thought- leadership, analytical, and people skills and be able to operate in a dynamic, fast paced environment. RESPONSIBILITIES Foster Hyphen’s customer-first mentality. Link customer, brand and market insights to growth and marketing strategy by defining the target user, what they care about and how we can best address their unmet needs. Lead establishing foundational insights for marketing and the organization at large - grounding the business in brand health, perception vs competition and industry trends. Design, coordinate and execute both qualitative and quantitative research that is best suited to generate actionable insights across brand, product and growth roadmaps. Forge a strong cross-functional relationship with product and user experience teams with the goal to elevate user needs and identify areas in the customer journey that will shepherd future innovation and growth. Play a critical role in defining Hyphen’s brand purpose. Define what makes Hyphen unique and differentiated, and how Hyphen can be brought to life through insightful positioning and bold, impactful plans. Drive Hyphen’s master brand strategy. Collaborate with product, marketing and creative teams to bring the brand vision to life and develop a messaging framework that all teams can build from. Identify tensions and opportunities that Hyphen can play a meaningful role in, and translate to sharp, inspiring actionable briefs. SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS 8+ years of strategy or marketing experience delivering insights 5+ years of leading a customer insights function Foundational experience learning in a top-tier brand company Demonstrated success defining and executing a learning agenda that drove meaningful brand and business growth Demonstrated business impact working on a top tier consumer brand MBA or similar qualification

Job_Title: Network Engineer (North East, up to $5000, Perm role)
Job_Descriptions: Designs, supports, coordinates, controls and operates internal data or voice communication systems or specialized components of a network whether data, voice or video including Local Area Networks (LANs), Wide Area Networks (WANs), and voice systems by conducting such activities as planning, configuring, testing, maintaining, troubleshooting and tuning network infrastructure which might include routers, switches, gateways, firewall systems, multi-function switches, end offices, signalling transfer points, private branch exchanges (PBXs), voice mail, call management systems (CMS) and network security devices. Essential Job Functions Maintains data, voice or video network hardware and systems; investigates and resolves network and hardware matters of significance; researches, analyses, isolates and resolves errors; assesses and updates older networks as needed and in accordance with specified plans. Provides technical support on data, voice or video networks for internal and/or external customers; answers technical questions; recommends and implements approved course of action. Provides technical leadership for data or voice network problem escalation and resolution. Installs and maintains network facilities, including hardware, software, and system data for small to medium sized networks. Installs network applications on network servers or voice equipment; maintains, tests, researches and resolves problems. Determines appropriate standard testing routines or scripts; may test various voice or data equipment such as routers, switches, hubs or optical equipment, or multi-function switches, end offices, signalling transfer points, private branch exchanges (PBX), voice mail, and call management system, etc. for maintenance. Designs, implements and maintains various networks such as LAN, WAN, and voice systems in accordance with specified requirements. Prepares data or voice network diagrams and drawings to document and assist in communicating current operational status of networks. Performs data or voice network configurations and configuration changes of various voice or data equipment such as routers, switches, intelligent hubs, multi-function switches, end offices, signalling transfer points, PBX, voice mail, call management systems, etc. to enhance performance. Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel. Prepares routine proposal documentation and information to meet customer requirements. Prepares routine cost analyses and vendor comparisons to ensure cost-effective and efficient operations, and measures feasibility of various approaches. Basic Qualifications Diploma or equivalent combination of education and working experience Diploma in engineering, computer science, management information systems, or related field preferred 2+ years of enterprise level experience with network switching, routing, firewalls, wireless networking, etc., or an equivalent combination of education, certification(s), and/or related experience Experience working with local area network systems and technical infrastructure communication issues Experience working with Data Centre networking and network architecture experience Experience working with Network security and network architecture experience Experience working with multiple technical platforms (e.g., mainframe, two-tiered client-server, three-tiered client-server) CCNA or Security+ desired/preferred All Successful candidates can expect a very competitive remuneration package and a comprehensive range of benefits.Alternatively, you may wish to email your resume in a detailed Word format to ******@peopleprofilers.com We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notifiedPeople Profilers Pte Ltd, 50 Raffles Place, #19-12, Singapore Land Tower, Singapore 048623 Tel: 6950 9748 http://www.peopleprofilers.com ******@peopleprofilers.comConsultant in charge: So Boon Shyen, Debbie EA Licence Number: 02C4944 Registration Number: R1111376

If you possess the passion, drive and leadership to excel, join us on our Management Associate Programme, as we embark on our journey to make life better for Singapore and Singaporeans. *All degrees are welcome for FPG MAP. For our Corporate Track – Digital & Technology, relevant degrees and/or experiences are preferred. OTHER INFORMATION Programme Structure Experience the Heart of Everything Food Through a structured rotational 21-month programme , corporate management associates are put through three rotations across identified departments within the organization, with the purpose of gaining appreciation into the heart of FairPrice Group, maximizing exposure through a mix of business projects/operations and showing aptitude for core competencies. We have four tracks in our growing businesses of Retail Business, Digital Business, Food Services, and Supply Chain , and three tracks in our corporate functions of Digital & Technology, Finance, and Customer & Marketing , where the management associates will develop in. Development & Engagement To build a positive ecosystem, various structured engagement initiatives such as onboarding, regular reviews, workshops and networking with the topline are put in place. At the end of the programme, given that the management associate has fulfilled the performance requirements, he/she would be promoted into the next job grade as part of an accelerated career trajectory. Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - FairPrice

The Department and position The department is responsible for development and maintenance of Capital Market applications used by worldwide users: from Front-Office (Murex, Apex, Orchestrade…), Back-Office (Summit, Calypso…) and Market Data Referential (Asset Control), Market Risk applications (in-house big data technology driven application). “Run the bank” is the first mission of the IT department. It involves many front line IT professionals who understand the nature of business operations, timing of activities & data flowing through internal and external systems. They are continuously work with business users, infrastructure engineers and system managers to keep the bank running. The candidate will join the Singapore Capital Market Run Control Tower that is in charge of the best practices of the run activities, as well as the reporting and being the gatekeeper of the production stability. Main responsibilities ü Develop automated reports and dashboards using Power BI. ü Connect to multiple datasets to bring all the relevant data together in one place and create reports that provide a consolidated view of the different sources. ü Creating Power BI reports that represent different findings & insights from the data using interactive charts and maps. ü Work with both functional and technical project personnel, providing in-depth knowledge of BI information delivery/presentation methodology. ü Document processes and ensure they are properly followed. ü Elaborating project documentations (Design documents, deployment guide etc.). ü Maintenance of existing BI projects Interacting and providing reporting to project managers/managers. ü Ensure high standard delivery to production. ü Proposing solutions for regarding continuous improvement. ü Provide investigation help while fostering knowledge and sharing best practices with team members. Qualifications and Profile Mandatory Ø At least 5 years in software development with thorough knowledge of scripting, data source integration and advanced GUI development in Power BI. Ø Familiar with any tracking tool like Jira. Ø Strong BI modelling skills using Analysis services with the ability translate reporting needs to a BI model which can serve the report as well as adhoc analytics. Ø 4+ years of experience in BI tools (tableau, qlikview etc.) with 2+ years’ experience in Power BI with in-depth development experience with recent versions of SQL Server. Ø Experience creating calculated measures and columns with DAX in MS Power BI Desktop. Ø Expert knowledge using advanced calculations using MS Power BI Desktop (Aggregate, Date, Logical, String, Table). Ø Strong knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server (2014-2017), MSSQL, SSRS (2014 and 2017), and SSIS (2014 and 2017). Ø You have experience in writing SQL queries and optimisation and knowledge in database engine and data model. Good to have Basic understanding of Microsoft Azure Cloud, Azure SQL database. Having knowledge of BIML is an added advantage. Having ITIL knowledge is an advantage as well as any experience in RUN activities. Basic understanding of finance and investment banking related reporting. Other Professional Skills and Mind-set Excellent written and verbal communication skills for both team mates and management. Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Proficient software development life cycle. Appetite to follow technology trend and participate to communities. Passion for sharing expertise and grow team members’ skills. Interest in mentoring and guiding junior team members on the path of high quality deliverables. Curiosity to learn new skills and work on new topics. Interested applicants, please email your resume to Shaun Quek Yew Meng. Manage and reinforce the quality department. Understand and implement customer requirements. Lead corrective action plans when needed. Measure and analyze quality performance. Responsible for planning, coordinating, and directing the Quality Management System relating to ISO9001 and ensuring continuous improvement which is consistent with established standards. Including final inspections. Familiar with the manual process and raw material with moving characteristics.

Job_Title: Regional Business Controller South East Asia
Job_Descriptions: Job description Atlas Copco Specialty Rental Division is looking for a Regional Business Controller South East Asia to support the ongoing growth in the region (Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, and Philippines). This role contributes directly to our customer’s experience, by ensuring that our business control mechanisms are customer orientated, fast, efficient, and accurate. The successful candidate will serve as an integral part of the management team of Specialty Rental South East Asia, reporting to and working closely with the General Manager. The Specialty Rental Division’s worldview is to enable our customers, our people, and our societies to flourish in an increasingly complex world. Our vision is to remain the world's most trusted partner by solving complex industrial challenges with specialized agile solutions. Those are designed and implemented by passionate people who continually strive for new best ways. Mission Statement The Business Controller’s mission is to ensure adequate internal control processes are in place whilst taking the role as strategic business partner in the company, creating value through excellent guidance and support which assists management to make informed decisions that help drive business strategy. - Ensure accurate and timely reporting in accordance with The Way We Do Things and the business requirements - Promote digitalisation in the finance department to drive change and create efficient, best practice processes - Lead a customer focused finance department which supports the business to be outward looking and responsive to customers’ expectations and needs - Understand the key drivers of the organization and how internal changes can impact the overall performance - Build strong internal relationships which lead to greater trust and greater influence in decision making - Act as a catalyst in driving initiatives critical to delivering business strategy - Establish a culture that encourages behaviours and actions to embrace growth, change and innovation - Create early warning indicators to anticipate any deviations in future expectations What you can expect from us? At Atlas Copco Specialty Rental, we subscribe to a different way of thinking, one that is built on a strong belief in the power of agility. We actively promote a culture of empowerment, allowing our employees to make a difference, rewarding passion, engagement, and solution thinking. We celebrate success together and embrace setbacks as opportunities. What we expect of you? Experience requirements The successful candidate should have a minimum of 5 years practical experience in business control or in a senior accounting or business controller support role. They will be able to demonstrate experience with ERP and accounting systems as well as statutory accounting and taxation requirements. Knowledge We are looking for a candidate with a university degree in accounting or a similar discipline who can demonstrate sound knowledge of The Way, accounting practices and Atlas Copco systems. Fluency in English is required. Educational requirements University degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance or similar. Personality requirements You should be dynamic and results oriented person, capable of working independently as well as enjoy being part of a team. Strong analytical skills, good attention to detail and a respect for deadlines are also key characteristics. We also expect you to always act with courage and integrity and to work in the Atlas Copco Way; communicate, behave and lead the Atlas Copco vision, mission and values. You should be culturally sensitive since this position will work closely with multiple cultures within the region. You should possess excellent communication skills which will allow you to communicate positively with all stakeholders to drive change. Country and city description South East Asia Region; Country tbc Additional information This position requires travelling within the South East Asia region.

This position provides oversight and drives continual improvement in the delivery of services to our school community of over 6,000 students, staff and parents. As such, the Contract Services Manager has shared responsibility for the quality of the schools services and the professional practice of the personnel supporting these services. Job_Title: Partner Engagement Manager, TV and Media Solutions, YouTube - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: The area: YouTube At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together. The role: Partner Engagement Manager, TV and Media Solutions, YouTube - Singapore Additional Role Description: The TV and Media Industry is changing and our team is focused on building the future of premium subscription content at YouTube. Our operations team works cross-functionally across engineering, product, business development and finance on a variety of initiatives spanning across YouTube TV, emerging content subscriptions and more. We are looking for proactive and passionate leaders who can help us scale operationally and support new product and partner launches. As a YouTube Partner Engagement Manager, you are a proven operations leader with a passion for shaping the future of premium media, a knack for efficiency and experience mentoring a team. You will utilize your deep video technology experience, industry expertise and existing relationships to advance YouTube’s global strategy. You will collaborate with many cross-functional teams, both internally and externally, to build a team that delivers high quality TV & media experiences for our users and partners. In this role, you will cultivate a team that is highly organized with meticulous attention to detail, diligent planning and tracking progress of key milestones, all while developing and maintaining deep relationships with our partners and stakeholders. The ideal candidate will be a leader who is passionate about YouTube and next generation media offerings, is an excellent problem solver, concise communicator, comfortable with ambiguity, and able to keep the team strategically focused. Responsibilities: - Lead a team that is on the front-lines of the onboarding and ongoing operations relationships with some of YouTube’s most strategic TV & media partners. - Leverage your TV & media industry expertise to identify and cultivate new content and technology opportunities and provide regular partner intelligence updates to cross-functional teams. - Ensure the team understands and represents YouTube’s technical interests during partner contract negotiations and can identify potential operational risks / mitigate those risks via cross-functional collaboration and creative problem solving with our partners. - Drive collaboration with internal teams to refine existing processes and tools used by partners and operators. - Partner with our Product, Business & Strategy teams to identify new partnership opportunities and support the operational needs for the region and product. Create and manage partner onboarding timelines for APAC. Minimum qualifications: - 3 years of experience as a people manager managing a team. - 5 years of experience in partner management, project management, product management or a similar technical operations role. - 5 years of experience working with external partners to identify technical issues and find resolutions. - Experience in TV and digital technologies. Preferred qualifications: - Experience in TV or digital streaming video technologies in APAC with the ability to articulate, implement, advocate, and shape emerging industry standards. - Experience identifying and incorporate emerging industry trends and standards. - Proven track record of successfully balancing multiple timelines, partners and priorities to drive timely and effective project execution. - Ability to navigate complex conversations to drive results between stakeholders with potentially competing priorities. - Ability to speak and write in English and Japanese, Korean or Hindi fluently, to support and communicate effectively with Japanese, Korean or Hindi-speaking and English-speaking clients. - Experience working as a product designer in a manufacturing environment (e.g. manufacturing HVAC equipment), or working in a mechanical design-build contractor as a project designer or onsite construction engineer. - Experience programming in Python. - Ability to travel internationally up to 25% of the time as needed.

Job_Title: Onboarding Sales Manager, Google Customer Solutions, SEA - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: The area: Google Customer Solutions (GCS) When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses. The role: Onboarding Sales Manager, Google Customer Solutions, SEA - Singapore Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. Additional Role Description: In the this role, you will focus on driving customer long-term sustainability for our large customers. We believe that an effective onboarding to increase the customer’s sustainability can be achieved through attentive support and regular communications. You will flex your strengths in product knowledge, consultative promoting, and account management. As an Onboarding Sales Manager, you will lead and coach high-performing account strategists teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the New Business Sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business. You'll help your teams to partner directly with clients to provide comprehensive solutions. Responsibilities: - Oversee business development, develop and execute on business plan for select South East Asia (SEA) market. Set quarterly goals and performance expectations with teams through regular feedback and weekly one-on-one meetings. - Work closely across different sales teams: Inbound (Scaled New Business/Scaled New Business Sales) and Direct Scaled Acquisition (DSA) to align and drive long-term customer sustainability. - Manage and coach Onboarding sales teams to deliver excellent performance. Develop their digital marketing expertise and build productive client partnerships. - Own Agency and cross-functional sales relationship for your markets. Ensure smooth delivery and a Googley customer experience. - Provide career coaching/performance feedback and development opportunities on a regular basis. Partner closely with marketing to onboard/promote self and marketing sign up customers as well as GCS sales team to ensure strong graduation pipeline. Minimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. - 9 years of experience in sales and delivering on business goals. - Experience building relationships with internal and external stakeholders. - Experience in people management. Preferred qualifications: - Experience in the digital advertising industry. - Experience in pipeline management and sales funnel management. - Experience leading teams with a focus on coaching and mentoring. - Experience with success in developing business teams and working towards goals. - Fundamental understanding in media or ads agency ecosystem. - Demonstrated diverse cultural understanding and comfortable working with diverse regional and global teams.

Server Systems Design should covers solution for Active Directory, DNS, Backup strategy. Provide the right capacity sizing for the solution. Maintain architecture documents and keep them up to date. ⇒ Qualifications & Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology with a minimum of 8-12+ years of experience or a Master’s degree in Computer Science or Information Technology with 6+ years of experience. At least 8 years’ experience in Technical Systems experience & Solution Architecture. Demonstrated knowledge of infrastructure, system and storage administration technologies. Excellent knowledge of VMware Virtualization, Scripting, Windows Server 2016/2019, Active Directory, Storage. Administration, Backup Strategy, Network. Experience in IT Disaster Recovery Planning and Execution. Demonstrated technical knowledge of design and development methodologies. Track record of being part of delivering value using Enterprise Architecture methodologies. Track record of communicating and influencing the customers and stakeholders. Track record of understanding company’s business and be able to tie back IT services to business needs. Leadership skills to independently take initiative and to innovate as part of a team. Agility in reaching milestones and goals including knowledge of and practices in agile methods of delivery. Knowledge and experience with aerospace, defense or transportation engineering industry. Experience with digital transformation initiatives. Excellent understanding of all IS/IT components of a large group. Excellent knowledge of AD architectures. Ability to animate teams with different IS/IT skills. Ability to manage different topics in parallel. Able to communicate effectively with others. Expertise in Carve-out projects.

Job_Title: Deployment Lead, Network Delivery Implementation - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: The area: Technical Infrastructure Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible. The role: Deployment Lead, Network Delivery Implementation - Singapore Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services. Additional Role Description: As the Deployment Lead of the Network Delivery Implementation team, you will be on the forefront of our efforts to execute deployment, maintenance, and operations of private data networks worldwide. You will work with Design/Infrastructure Engineers, Field Engineers, Strategic Negotiators, and Technical Project Managers within Google, as well as construction and telecommunications Vendors and Contractors, all to position your team and Organization for success. Your leadership and management skills will be leveraged to facilitate faster, better, and more efficient, positive outcomes for the business and our customers. Your team's objective will be to build the world’s most reliable, cost-effective, and scalable network to support all of our current and future customers and users globally. Responsibilities: - Oversee a team of network engineers responsible for the delivery of network capacity and infrastructure across a defined geographical region in Asia Pacific (APAC). - Set team level direction and strategy. Build, develop, and grow team capabilities to deliver key business outcomes. - Provide technical leadership and guidance during deployment activities delivering business outcomes and escalating issues where appropriate. - Work with partner network teams to assess risks and potentials in alignment with forecasts and high-level build to plan. - Identify and drive new initiatives/programs/processes to create efficiency/process improvements/optimize resources and address gaps/risk cross-functionally. Minimum qualifications: - 8 years of experience in network installation, network infrastructure, and optical networking - 5 years of experience in people management - 5 years of experience in colocation and with data center operations - 5 years of experience in program management within a technical field Preferred qualifications: - Experience in logistics and supply chain management - Experience in operations management - Experience with operations and third-part colocation environments

National Sales Manager Company Description About Toll Group At Toll, we do more than just logistics - we move the businesses that move the world. Our 20,000 team members can help solve any logistics, transport or supply chain challenge – big or small. We have been supporting our customers for more than 130 years. Today, we support more than 20,000 customers worldwide with 500 sites in 25 countries, and a forwarding network spanning 150 countries. We are proudly part of Japan Post — www.tollgroup.com Job Description We are looking for a National Sales Manager to join our Global Forwarding team in Singapore. In this role, you will develop & execute the Sales Strategy for the country to achieve set Budgets & Targets. The role As a National Sales Manager, you will be responsible for: Building & leading an industry leading Sales Organisation to achieve economies of scale. You will also develop sustainable strategies for the business and sales people and will be accountable for the sales organisations’ overall performance Driving volume growth and maximizing profitability by reviewing/linking sales source, market trends, cost allocation & company’s capabilities. Developing & executing country sales plan in line with country budget and ensuring that Sales KPIs are met or exceeded at any time Leading, mentoring & developing the Sales Team. Setting local sales objectives & priorities to meet clients’ needs & achieve company’s growth target Building key contact and relationships within Toll Network. Acting as primary Sales contact for regional sales organization & key network partners. Actively engaging with Product Managers to create initiative plans / products to achieve Sales targets Identifying underperforming segments and recommend solutions for improving performance / quality. Providing recommendations and ensuring quality and submission of sales reports for management review. Also monitoring services level and ensure customers satisfaction Actively participating & leading business opportunities of strategic importance and owning the country Sales Process to ensure data quality is constantly above 95% on our Global CRM platform Qualifications About you To be successful in this role, you will need: Bachelors Degree in relevant discipline with hands on freight forwarding sales experience Experience of at least 2 -3 years managing a sales team Knowledge of freight forwarding operations and selling process (Air, Ocean & Custom). Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Proven ability to plan, develop and execute business development strategies Additional information Be Connected With a bold vision and innovative drive, join our 20,000 colleagues as we lead industry change and transform how customers best meet their global supply chain needs in a meaningful and sustainable way. There are countless opportunities to learn and make a real impact in shaping our industry’s future. Grow with diverse challenges amongst a friendly and inclusive global culture. Take pride in building relationships that matter, because being connected is at the centre of what makes Toll great – it’s what makes our possibilities endless. Toll embraces and celebrates a variety of cultures. We continue to build a business that reflects the values of equality, built on the knowledge and understanding that everyone is welcome including the First Nations Peoples and those of all ages, genders and abilities. To find out more about us visit www.tollgroup.com/careers You must be entitled to work in Singapore and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical.

⇒ Summary of Role Drive IT Security Engineering function as a SME for Group and all Business Units (10 Business Units) in Asia Pacific. Define and partner with stakeholders in a multi-disciplined team structure, designing and implementing cloud security solutions to provide coverage across a variety of projects. Lead stakeholders’ and vendors engagements and providing subject matter expertise to Business Units and engagement teams. Develop deep working relationships with senior executives across engagement teams. Responsible and execute large-scale project deliveries. Manage teams and mentor junior resources. Oversee infrastructure and microservices security architecture (inclusive of: container security architecture, data security architecture, network security architecture and operational security architecture). Review the infrastructure & microservices design against different security regulatory, industry and internal standards such as PCI DSS and CSA Containers' security guidelines and identifying the necessary security architecture requirements for the same. Ensure that final design addresses identified threats and countermeasures during threat modelling. Lead the growth of cloud security practice across business units, project team and other stakeholders. Drive IT Security Engineering Initiatives and Projects definition and implementation, selection of solutions and architecture, as well as define operations framework and its continuous improvement. ⇒ Responsibilities Support the Head of Cyber Transformation & Identity in define and maintain the IT Security Engineering framework for Group. Drive awareness and support to Group IT Security, Group IT and Business Units IT, to understand the IT Security Solutions and Processes, as well as their implications across the organization. Drive IT Security Engineering Initiatives and Projects definition and implementation, selection of solutions and architecture, as well as define operations framework and its continuous improvement. Partner with the Head of Cyber Transformation & Identity and Group CISO, through tracking and reporting function, to ensure regular updates to management on the IT Security Engineering Program and risks. ⇒ Key Performance Indicators On Time on Budget delivery of key IT Security Engineering Program uplifts or deployments, aligned with Group IT Security roadmap. Support the Head of IT Security Engineering in continuous uplift of the IT Security Engineering program. Ensure IT Security Engineering Program across Business Units is carried out in alignment with the business objectives and defined IT Security Plan timelines. Group IT Security Engineering Security Framework implementation and controls are delivered in a cost-effective way using processes and resources (including people and technologies) aligned with the business goals. Group IT Security Engineering support and governance are provided for all Business Units. IT Security Engineering Program awareness is conducted when necessary. Doing things right, creating synergies for the overall goals and objectives, along with a people first approach. ⇒ Qualifications & Experience Must have a solid knowledge of implementing Splunk Enterprise. Proven experience of delivering complex projects. Ability to communicate complex concepts to mosaic stakeholders. Ability to be self-managed and driven by business and personal goals. Minimum 8 years working experience in IT Security Management role, preferably in Financial Services. Regional experience in IT Security Technical or Engineering roles. Degree from Information Technology or equivalent discipline. Technical experience in Identify, Protect, Detect, Response or Recover areas. Certifications or official training on Splunk. General networking and security troubleshooting (firewalls, routing, NAT, etc.). Splunk implementation and troubleshooting experience. Experience with Splunk Enterprise Security or integration with other Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) platforms. Proficient at data on-boarding activities including routing, parsing, and normalizing events to the Splunk Common Information Model (CIM). Experience collaborating with separate engineering teams to configure data sources for Splunk integration. Proficiency onboarding data using Splunk developed add-ons for Windows, Linux, and common third-party devices and applications. Experience onboarding data into Splunk via forwarder, scripted inputs, TCP/UDP, and modular inputs from a variety of sources. Proficiency managing Splunk using the Splunk command-line interface. Excellent interpersonal and influential skills to enable the implementation and enforcement of the IT Security Engineering program. Good communication and presentation skills.

About Citi: Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. As a bank with a brain and a soul, Citi creates economic value that is systemically responsible and in our clients’ best interests. As a financial institution that touches every region of the world and every sector that shapes your daily life, our Enterprise Operations & Technology teams are charged with a mission that rivals any large tech company. Our technology solutions are the foundations of everything we do from keeping the bank safe, managing global resources, and providing the technical tools our workers need to be successful to designing our digital architecture and ensuring our platforms provide a first-class customer experience. We reimagine client and partner experiences to deliver excellence through secure, reliable, and efficient services. Our commitment to diversity includes a workforce that represents the clients we serve from all walks of life, backgrounds, and origins. We foster an environment where the best people want to work. We value and demand respect for others, promote individuals based on merit, and ensure opportunities for personal development are widely available to all. Ideal candidates are innovators with well-rounded backgrounds who bring their authentic selves to work and complement our culture of delivering results with pride. If you are a problem solver who seeks passion in your work, come join us. We’ll enable growth and progress together. The Application Vulnerability Assessments Analyst provides application security services to Citi businesses early in the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Candidates collaborate with development organizations to onboard applications to our automated security testing platform and performing secure code review assessments using commercial tools such as Burp, Checkmarx, and Fortify. Responsibilities: Manage and execute security assessments for multiple agile projects simultaneously and ensure project timelines are met. Identify opportunities to automate and standardize information security controls and for the supported groups Analyze source code to mitigate identified weaknesses and vulnerabilities within the system Scan and analyze applications with automated tools, and perform manual testing if necessary Collaborate with application teams to ensure that any identified security vulnerabilities are remediated in a timely manner. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Utilize Static Application Security Testing (SAST), Interactive Application Security Testing (IAST), and Component Vulnerability Management (CVM) tools such as Checkmarx, Contrast, and Black Duck to uncover additional vulnerabilities during Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST). Qualifications: At least 5 years of relevant experience in Java web development, source code review, or application security testing. Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication. Good understanding of Java concepts, SAST tools such as Fortify, Checkmarx and DAST tools such as Burp, AppScan. Must have a strong understanding of ethical hacking methodologies, frameworks, and industry resources, e.g., OWASP, OSSTMM, NIST publications, SANS/CWE, among others. Education: Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience Master’s degree preferred

Job_Title: Market Responsibility Team Lead, YouTube - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: The area: YouTube At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together. The role: Market Responsibility Team Lead, YouTube - Singapore Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, YouTube’s Trust & Safety team is dedicated to making YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to belong, create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust & Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world. Additional Role Description: As a Market Responsibility Team Lead managing a local market and leading the wider team, you will be responsible for ensuring that we are constantly growing our understanding of regional and local trends and risks on YouTube. You will proactively monitor trends and intelligence sources, help to launch new product features with market and language knowledge, and ensure our enforcement guidelines are informed by your market knowledge. You'll help implement and enforce our policies across content videos, as well as define and implement operational plans globally, liaising and working with stakeholders in areas such as Product Management, Engineering, Vendor Operations, Analytics, Public Policy, PR, Partnerships, and Legal. In this role, you may review graphic, controversial, and sometimes offensive video content during team escalations in line with YouTube’s Community Guidelines. Responsibilities: - Act as a team Lead in the Market Responsibility Specialist team, in addition to India market focus. - Monitor intel sources, work with cross-functional teams, and leverage market expertise to identify key abuse trends in the Indian market, monitor emerging sensitive events, and highlight risks to the YouTube ecosystem and Trust and Safety. - Speak Hindi and another local language fluently in order to effectively identify and propose policy improvements based on market nuances, and support language detection, automation, language quality improvements, and local product launches. - Triage threats, prepare risk assessments and action plans based on market knowledge and act as the main point of contact. - Drive and support the launch of news-related product features, as well as other responsibility projects in the region, and communicate effectively. Minimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience in tech policy, intelligence or regulations/government relations. - 7 years of experience working in the APAC region and managing the Indian market. - Experience leading and managing people, projects, and groups of cross-functional stakeholders. - Ability to speak and write in English and Hindi fluently to identify abuse trends. Preferred qualifications: - Experience in people management or team leadership. - Experience with the history, local politics, media landscape, and context of the Indian market. - Experience working with Product Management and Engineers to drive progress on key programs. - Strategic and analysis skills, including the ability to lead a team to frame problems, structure analyses, and drive to impact. - Exceptional communication skills to drive consensus across cross-functional partners. - Excellent organizational and project management skills with great attention to detail.

Job Functions The Host/ess is an essential member of the Food & Beverage team dedicated to providing exceptional quality and service to our guests. By nature of the position, the host/ess is the guest’s first impression of the restaurant. This Host/ess greets guests promptly, courteously, graciously with eye contact, and a smile. Utilizing Open Table, the Host/ess takes reservations, reviews the daily reservation book and has the ability to seat guests without reservations. The Host/ess has a complete working knowledge of the menus, menu ingredients and what is unavailable for that day. A principle role within the restaurant, the Host/ess is familiar with server stations, their daily assignments, their personal timing patterns and their maximum workload capacity. The ability to remain calm under pressure is essential and applicants must have a flexible schedule with the ability to work all shifts, weekends and holidays.

Job_Descriptions: Job Description To manage and optimize operations in the waste management industry. The Operations Executive is responsible for assisting the management with the daily operations. He/She consolidates relevant data and trends to conduct environmental impact assessments and improvise work processes. He also evaluates reported mechanical faults to rectify issues. In performing most of these functions, he recommends and facilitates the implementation and maintenance schedules of equipment and manages incidents related to waste disposal operations. He/She works in a waste management and oversees the handling and disposal operations while ensuring that all activities are completed in a safe and efficient way. He is constantly exposed to unpleasant sights and smells. He also manages team and incidents relating to operations and vehicle/equipment cleanliness and serviceability and communicates with relevant stakeholders and clients. He is organised, responsive, approachable, able to multi-task and capable of interacting with stakeholders. Job_Title: R0180291 - Chief Administrative Office – Lead Anti-Financial Crime Advisor - Director
Job_Descriptions: Details of the Division and Team: Deutsche Bank (DB) is committed to the highest standards of Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery and Corruption (AFBC) and Anti-Fraud & Investigations (AF&I) and wider Financial Crime (collectively referred to as Anti Financial Crime) prevention. The Management and all employees are required to adhere to these standards to protect DB and our reputation from those who may intend to use our products and services for money laundering, bribery, corruption, fraud and/or Terrorist Financing (TF) purposes. DB Group will examine its Anti-Financial Crime (AFC) strategies, goals and objectives on an ongoing basis and maintain an effective program for DB’s business that reflects the best practices for a diversified, global financial services provider. The Singapore Anti-Money Laundering Department, forms part of Anti Financial Crime Division and supports Deutsche Bank businesses in Singapore in managing AML risk, is responsible for ensuring related processes are in place and that all policies, procedures and guidelines conform to internal DB policies and MAS regulations. The operations in Singapore include banking (Wholesale and Merchant Bank) and capital markets services licensees. What we will offer you: A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center. You can expect: Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services Comprehensive leave benefits Gender Neutral Parental Leave Flexible working arrangements 25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement Your key responsibilities: Advising on and ensuring implementation of AFC policies and procedures; whereas involvement in ABC and AFI policies would be supported by assigned ABC and AFI headcounts located in Singapore having accountability of their respective functions with local reporting line into the Head of AFC Singapore. Advising on the impact of new AFC related internal and external rules and ensuring that local guidelines and procedures are in line and reflect German and local laws / regulations. Escalate exceptions to the Regional Head of AFC. Assessing the conformity of internal policies and procedures, systems and controls with relevant regulatory obligations and DB Group standards. Being point of contact for AFC matters with competent regulatory, law enforcement or other public authorities in Singapore such as MAS and CAD. Reporting and liaising with Regional Head of AFC and other AFC Senior Management to ensure appropriate reporting and escalation of issues and/or incidents. Contributing to DB AFC Function as a whole by sharing knowledge and best practices with AFC Officers of the other Businesses and entities and other functional Heads of AFC. Contribute to the development of AFC methodologies by cooperating with other disciplines like Compliance, Legal, Audit and Operational Risk Management. Ensuring timely delivery of the local AFC Risk Assessment in the country leveraging off regional assessments performed for AFC topics. Providing AFC advice in the change management process including but not limited to the New Product Approval (NPA) and Vendor Risk Management (VRM) Process. Helping maintain an AFC compliance staff awareness culture by providing appropriate training to staff and arranging training by other regional functional leads for Sanctions & Embargoes and AFBC. Oversight of local Training and ensure that AFC Training requirements are met in conjunction with the aforementioned leads. Developing and maintaining the AFC related Internal Control Framework under advice from Regional AFC Risks & Controls to ensure adequate monitoring and control measures are implemented, report on any findings and advise management on remedial actions to take. Complying with the requirements set by the AFC Global Assurance Programme. Develop and carry out adequate controls to ensure that all applicable legal and regulatory AFC requirements are being adhered to in Singapore Your skills and experience: At least 10 years’ experience, ideally in a similar senior position with extensive experience in AFC or a control related function within an international organization/bank in the Financial Services industry A strong track record in risk and regulatory matters, ideally including: i) Solid understanding of AFC risks and typologies in order to identify areas or instances of potential AFC risks and to address them appropriately ii) Prior experience of acting as regulatory liaison with regards to AFC matters iii) Any other experience required under the various appropriate regulations/laws and related circulars. Excellent understanding of financial products. Possess Financial Crime functional expertise and considered a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in the Financial Crime related laws and regulation. Proven leadership ability, including skills to build, develop and coach a team. Able to absorb complex issues arising from a wide span of business and control areas and demonstrate sound judgment in decision making. Excellent at building trust and managing relationships. Excellent at advising senior management with great skill, with a high level of executive presence, knowledge and stature to provide advice that will be respected and valued by business unit leaders, corporate leaders and other constituencies. Strong communication and influencing skills, and possess the highest level of integrity and the ability to balance commercial objectives with the exercise of independent and prudent judgment. Able to raise sensitive or potentially contentious issues in a constructive manner to reach reasonable solutions. Excellent at setting clear objectives and driving for results, for example facilitating the creation of processes, systems, and disciplines that embed behaviours in the organization that ensure compliance. Able to identify issues and solutions or opportunities, as well as to build efficacy in AFC programs. Able to motivate employees, building teams and fostering relationships that engender a sense of shared objectives and accountability. The ability to recruit, develop, and retain team members while operating successfully in a matrix environment is critical. How we’ll support you: Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities Coaching and support from experts in your team A culture of continuous learning to aid progression A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs Training and development to help you excel in your career About us and our teams: Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. click here to see what we do. Deutsche Bank & Diversity: Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer. We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation. Click here to find out more about our diversity and inclusion policy and initiatives.

The area: Marketing Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself. The role: Operations Manager, Marketing Operations - Singapore Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the representation of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. Additional Role Description: Google’s Marketing Operations team is here to inspire and enable our best work. Our programs are focused on Agency Management, Production Operations, Marketing Technology, and Contract Operations. As an Operations Manager within Marketing Operations, you will deliver full pieces of a program to determine how to scale, launch, standardize, and optimize operational processes of Marketing Operations’ programs and initiatives. You’ll use project management skills and expertise to bring our extensive strategic plan to life. You will build bridges and connection points with cross-functional teams across marketing, finance, legal, engineering, product development, and more. Your experience will help us unlock new ways of working and enable us to expand our reach to Marketers. Responsibilities: - Partner with teams to drive execution of key initiatives by collaborating with cross-functional teams to influence, implement, extend, manage, and evolve our operational processes and models for our marketers and agencies. - Partner across Marketing Operations and the broader Marketing organization to implement, maintain, and continuously optimize operating models meant to focus on ways of working between teams. - Provide clear communication to cross-functional team leads and management regarding status of projects (e.g., proposals, roadmaps, resource requirements, issues, and priorities). - Drive continuous improvement across the team by implementing systems and processes as needed, partnering with the broader Marketing Operations Program Management team. - Implement, track, and prioritize project roadmaps and schedules for specific initiatives that align with the broader strategy for the Marketing Operations team; remove roadblocks, identify risks, and propose mitigation plans. Minimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience in operations management. - 4 years of experience in a program/operations role with a marketing and/or creative agency. Preferred qualifications: - Experience with success in executing on complex, ambiguous cross-functional, and global initiatives. - Experience establishing effective relationships, influencing and driving consensus, and collaborating internally and externally at all organizational levels. - Experience working on both the agency and client-side with global experience (e.g., program manager, project manager, operations manager). - Experience of successfully rolling out complex, global initiatives. - Ability to effectively operate in a fast-paced, constantly evolving, team environment. - Ability to work with ambiguity, solve complex problems, and scale effectively across a large organization and highly distributed and often, remote team.

The area: Sales Operations The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done. The role: APAC Go-To-Market Lead, Search - Singapore Additional Role Description: Go-To-Market Performance encompasses some of Google’s fastest growing, most prominent and advanced advertising, and measurement products, including Search, Shopping, Apps, Privacy-Centric Measurement. As the Asia Pacific (APAC) Go-To-Market Lead, you will be part of the Search and Commerce GTM team, and lead the product strategy and activation for Google’s suite of Search, Shopping, and Retail associated products that assist businesses and partners to obtain highly qualified traffic. The team partners closely with APAC sales leadership and teams, Search and Shopping specialists, GTM, and global counterparts to drive the respective sales strategy and initiatives for the region. They own the development of supporting operations, product strategy, and in-market activation to drive business impact and growth outcomes. In this role, you will be responsible for creating and executing effective go-to-market plans for our suite of Search automated bidding products, with a particular focus on Value Optimization, where you will help advertisers to unlock growth by successfully aligning conversion value to their most important business key performance indicators (KPIs). Partnering closely with country activation specialists and sales teams across the region, you will drive the adoption and optimal use of these products, while simultaneously collecting insights and feedback to improve them through partnership with Global Product teams. You will leverage your customer-centric mindset, deep curiosity for how Search product features work together, and collaboration with Search GTM peers to build holistic strategies and initiatives that establish Search’s power as a driver for customer growth. Responsibilities: - Create, execute, and refine the ads product go-to-market strategy for Search in APAC, with focus on Value optimization. - Drive adoption of key Search products by influencing and equipping sales specialists and sales communities across the region. - Identify gaps in products and build business cases based on customers needs; partner with Global Product Leads on your product area roadmap. - Identify business opportunities with market and competitive insights. Partner with cross-functional teams to develop and execute regional programs, initiatives. - Execute projects to drive step change improvements in product adoption and sales capability. Minimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. - 7 years of experience in the digital advertising industry or marketing functions. Preferred qualifications: - Experience working with Google Ads suite (e.g., Search Ads 360 (SA360)). - Experience working in or with Asia-Pacific markets. - Ability to define a vision and strategy and build relationships with key stakeholders to achieve it. - Excellent analytical skills, with a high degree of comfort with data-driven problem-solving. - Excellent project management skills to deliver initiatives on time and to specification with high autonomy. - Effective written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to pitch messaging to stakeholders of varying levels.

The Group Head of People will be responsible for reimagining OnlinePajak’s people function, culture, structure and policies. S/he will drive key Human Resources (HR) best practices and initiatives and provide strategic direction and expertise for the full scope of the HR functions (recruitment, learning and development, compensation and rewards, and HR ops), across all offices internationally. Reporting to the GCOO, the Head of People will design, develop and execute the HR strategy for the organization and partner with the Senior Management Team to execute the vision. S/he will oversee the HR team and be responsible for leading, assessing, mentoring and supporting team member to ensure daily HR operations are handled with excellence. Responsibilities: Strategic Develop and implement a human resources plan that aligns with the overall mission and strategy of the organization, resulting in innovative, best practices and policies that will service the full range of OnlinePajak’s HR needs. Support building a high-performing culture of success, accountability, transparency and collaboration. Act as a strategic partner to all members of the Senior Management Team (SMT), especially the COO and CEO, and provide insightful, innovative thinking and problem solving on critical HR issues. Optimize the HR function/team, modernize and refine key processes and activities aligned towards achieving strategic objectives. Provide HR guidance on special projects, HR analytics & reporting, talent reviews, training, change management, organizational design, diversity and inclusion. Operational Proactively manage resource allocation and maintain a competitive approach to recruiting. Own all people programs and processes to enhance talent attraction, retention, development, and succession. Partner with Finance in overseeing company’s budget and headcount. Develop comprehensive approaches to employee development, retention and onboarding by refining or creating: compensation and benefits, career paths and employee development, succession planning, and learning opportunities as appropriate to the needs of the company. Oversee compensation and reward practices and philosophy to ensure salary, non-monetary and RSU’s benchmarking and surveys are handled on a regular basis. Respond to the HR demands of a matrixed organization with geographically distributed field offices in Jakarta, Sydney and Singapore. Defining the HR policy at the country and regional level. Driving and leading the HR team in Performance Management, Talent Acquisition, Learning & Development, Engagement, Benefits, Rewards, Visa and Immigration, Policy and Compliance. Partner with IT and related systems (FreshTeams), protocols, capabilities, and upgrades. Interact with head-hunters to create and maintain relationships and negotiate contracts. Partner with Legal to ensure compliance & mitigate organizational risks. Culture and Development Develop relationships with the employees and become someone who is sought for advice and counsel on HR, cultural, and organizational issues. Facilitate integration of diverse workgroups and cultures. Coach and counsel SMT in developing themselves and their teams to achieve improved performance and engagement. Counsel, coach and guide managers and staff in addressing concerns and complaints to assure fair and equitable treatment while ensuring compliance with local labour regulations and practices. Coach and mentor fellow colleagues/managers and develop leadership bench strength capable of addressing the challenges of a highly dynamic organization. Mediate employee relations and performance issues and provide counsel to fellow managers on appropriate methods of performance management and promotions. Role model of OnlinePajak’s core values and demonstrate leadership consistently with all members of the our community.
